Reviews.Title: “Nice Pool area but rooms are small and bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: May M
Reviews.Content: Before we leave Singapore we have stayed here for 15 days the price is cheap compare to the other hotel in Singapore. Rooms are clean but no window if you will book for with window it's with additional payment. But the location is nice 10 to 15mins walking you already in Novena mrt station I've been living in SIngapore for 1 and half year I get to use on walking. But if you don't want to walk you can ride a bus going to MRT. Location is near to Orchard area 1 bus ride and you're there. Pool area is really nice as well as the gym.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay ! Free wifi - clean rooms - great pool”
Reviews.Author: estelle e
Reviews.Content: We had free breakfast daily - access to pool and gym - wifi was okay - a little unreliable but still good - staff were friendly - location was a little far from downtown - about a 10 dollar taxi ride - overall this hotel offered a clean facility and room.

Reviews.Title: “not much of a hotel for ther price”
Reviews.Author: denise b
Reviews.Content: We paid too much for so little...small rooms. had to pay for a window in our room. ten dollars extra..No breakfast or eating facilities. the only plus was there was a bus stop nearby, I would not recomment this hotel for the clostraphobic.

Reviews.Title: “convenient”
Reviews.Author: ian_aus
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for price and was slightly concerned about the location but ended up being very happy as the Novena MRT is an easy 10 min walk from the hotel and cabs are cheap in Singapore anyways. If you were staying here for an overnight stopover the windowless rooms would be okay otherwise for longer stays spend the extra and get a room with a view..unfortunately I can't recommend the included breakfast, After one morning I opted for the local eateries directly across from the hotel and was pleasantly surprised, you just can't seem to go wrong with the Singapore food! The all-in-one wet toilet/shower room might upset fussier guests but it seemed to work out fine. The pool was fantastic! I'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is all about price, not comfort; it's NOT for business people.”
Reviews.Author: PilotMike2009
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Value Hotel in Singapore in April 2012. While it is relatively new, modern, clean and convient, for a business person trying to be productive 24x7, it really fell short. The ONLY reason to choose this hotel is because the price is pretty good -- about US$70. My feeling is just like Dan801 and TLumbi; this hotel is too small, too basic; too much value and not enough hotel! The first problem was finding the place. Three out of three taxi drivers had never heard of it! Plus, there are TWO other Value Hotels on Balestier, both very small Chinese-style hotels. So tell the driver it's right off the PIE, Thomson Road exit, and it's just two streets down from Thomson on the left. On the plus side -- this is a pretty convenient location. During my visit I drove all over Singapore, and ended up in the middle of the island every night, right near this hotel. Once you finally get to the hotel, check-in is fast and easy because there's always an army of people behind the check-in counter. But here's the second surprise -- the "Delux" rooms which I ordered on-line DON'T HAVE WINDOWS! If you want windows, that's a $10 a day upgrade. The hallways are uncarpeted, which means noise in hallways outside your room echoes loudly. The room was tiny, and more than once I crashed into the coffee-counter on the way to the toilet. There are no amenities like luggage racks, soaps and such. The worst offense, in my mind, is the awful design of making the shower and the bathroom one room; once you use the shower, the toilet is covered with soapy water, the floor is wet and your shaving kit is soaked. I was able to get the WIFI to work, but there was only ONE electrical outlet in the whole room, designed to serve the teapot. So I sat on the bed and typed my emails -- acceptable maybe for one evening, but not for a week. In the spirit of full disclosure, I did discover one bright-spot: the hotel has a TERRIFIC swimming pool and a work out room on the 7th floor. See photo; it's really nice. The hotel has no food service. For food, you go to the adjacent restaurant and pay S$11.80 for breakfast. Dinner was also offered, a bit expensive for what you get, but they had some nice wines from Chile and New Zealand, so it wasn't a total waste. If I had more time, I would have explored the neighborhood and I'm sure I could have found better foods at lower prices. Overall, while this might be fine for school groups or 20-somethings backpacking around the globe, from my perspective it was pretty awful and I will not be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: sanju s
Reviews.Content: We started our trip from singapore at the Value Thomson and loved our stay. The style of the hotel is not quite to our taste - the rooms are small but comfortable and very well-appointed - The service was impeccable made up for it. Additional bottle of water is provided upon request. I enjoyed pool side with good view in the evening . . The concierge was extremely helpful with directions, suggestions and general information. He pointed us to various good tourism spot that we wouldn't have found ourselves. Nothing was too much trouble.Also, we got free wifi that was incredible and speed also very good. Service and hospitality is ingrained in every staff of the hotel, from the moment u check in , to after u check out. All in all a hotel I would recommend without reserve.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, cheap price for Singapore.”
Reviews.Author: dan801
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week in Singapore so we didn't want to spent $150 + dollars a night on accommodation. The hotel offers very basic facilities, the rooms are very very small. The bathroom is a combined shower over toilet style design. We changed to a windowed room as the windowless rooms were too clostaphobic and smelled due to no sun and air. They have free wifi but we needed a new password every time you log out and leave hotel so it's a pain. MRT is a long walk. 20min in heat. Buses are out the front which you can take to MRT. There is shops and 7/11's adjoining the hotel. Overall good value for money in an expensive town but don't expect much for your money. Get a window room is my only advice.

Reviews.Title: “Value, Not Quite.”
Reviews.Author: TLumbi
Reviews.Content: I will say, if this hotel were $35USD a night, my review would be very different. As a couple traveling Asia, I have concluded our standards are much different than the other reviewers on this site. A hotel with "Value" in the name combined with a price of $90+ USD... our expectation is that it will be clean, modern, and comfortable. With no closet and no room for our luggage to be out of the walk way, comfortable scored very low. The rooms were not insulated so this ensured that you hear the other clients and hotel staff moving carts throughout the night... again, not very comfortable. The shower next to the toilet took some adjusting (fine), but the smell and mildew on the bathmat was just horrendous. It contained a plastic base, that was never changed and sat in a damp bathroom with no window. This is not what I would expect from a $90+ a night hotel... anywhere in the world. Not to mention, that we had to pay extra for a "WINDOW". The internet cut when too many people were in the hotel. As business travelers, this was quite frustrating. The staff was not very helpful on this issue. Coffee was watered-down and not good so we chose to walk 10 minutes to get a decent cup of coffee. I will say, the hotel lobby was very inviting and clean. The doorman always had a smile and the elevator was wonderful. The pool... it was a pool. Nothing above standard. Basic layout, some trees that were placed in odd locations, with standard lounge chairs. The location of the hotel is tucked in the middle of construction zones. Makes it a bit unpleasant to try and relax at the pool after battling the traffic. If clients continue to accept below-standard accommodations, this will never improve in Singapore. It is a shame that in 2012, $90+ USD a night gets you semi-crap with a clean bed. If we are VALUE clients, we should care where our money goes and what it buys us.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, not great location.”
Reviews.Author: lucy j
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend and it was very comfortable, however we had to take a long taxi journey to get into the city everyday. The hotel pool is great, but the rooms are quite small but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, very clean and good location.”
Reviews.Author: Hampstead30
Reviews.Content: Adequate room, on the small side but very clean. Convenient for using as somewhere just to sleep. Has a small swimming pool with quite a nice surroundings amongst the nearby skyscrapers.

Reviews.Title: “Small room for sleep”
Reviews.Author: VictorDragono
Reviews.Content: Not much for this hotel, due we only use it for sleep. Very small room, tv cable, and sometimes people use it for short time. Small pool in the roof, no breakfast, better booked by internet due price different is big. 10 minutes walk from Novena MRT

Reviews.Title: “Value Hotel Thomson, Singapore”
Reviews.Author: JTJuan
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is very convenient for those who will be taking the bus most of the time but area is quite far from the MRT stations. You may need to take a bus before you reach the nearest MRT station. It is very easy to go to Orchard and Vivo City if you will be staying in this hotel since buses from these areas will stop at your doorstep! Room is small for more than 2 persons but everything is clean from the bathroom to the bedsheets and pillows. Room has water heater for coffee and tea breaks. There is no restaurant in the hotel but convenience stores and fast food are just around the corner. This is one of the cheapest hotels I have stayed in Singapore and will recommend this to friends too.

Reviews.Title: “Service was disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Angela2501
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small but they seemed clean so that wasn't too big a deal. Some of the reviews mentioned the bathroom with no divide, it was a little annoying because everything was wet. All of this would have been ok if the staff were friendly. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “good enough to sleep”
Reviews.Author: BoreiAngkorHotel
Reviews.Content: Really a value hotel where you just need a room to sleep after lots of working in Singapore. Room is clean and good enough space, Staffs are friendly and always provide help whenever you approach them. Good restaurant on the door step in case you just want to feel you stomach. Will sty there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.. Nice budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: deo35
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days and we find it convenient for us because the transportation was not a problem it’s near from a bus stop. The accommodation is good with a helpful and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced closet”
Reviews.Author: nzakaria
Reviews.Content: The bed took up 3/4 of the available floor space. The shower, toilet and washbasin are all in a room less than 2m x 2m with no divider so everything is wet most of the time. there is not much space. they give you one coffee sachet (no milk no tea). there is no safe for your valuables. no bar fridge. Everything about this hotel seems to be more about cost cutting and less about guest comfort. there are better options.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Josh S
Reviews.Content: This place was incredibly cheap, but clean and tidy with friendly staff. Only complaint was the dirty air conditioning which resulted in constant sneezing/coughing while it was on - a minor gripe. The rooftop pool was great for relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience when arriving in SIngapore late”
Reviews.Author: Turista42
Reviews.Content: Located right above an MRT station the V Hotel is a good option if you want to find a place to sleep in before heading on to other destinations The rooms are clean and reasonable but pretty small - and I come from Hong Kong so I know small hotel rooms! No bedside lights which is a pain when getting up in the middle of the night There is a pool but it s a rather depressing affair

Reviews.Title: “The best budget hotel in SG - in my point of view”
Reviews.Author: pwl17
Reviews.Content: If you only have 100-120 dollar to spend for a night and you hear a lot about Hotel 81 ... pick Value Hotel Thomson. Don't bother about other branches they have, those are very far away from the MRT. Whenever my family/relatives visit to SG - I will always arrange them to stay there. Clean hotel and it is close to a lot of good food ... 15 min walk to MRT but there are buses to everywhere, you are quite close to Orchard, the shopping belt in Singapore. With the price you pay and the quality, cleanliness ... it is definitely a good value budget hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value For Money Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Ignatiusdestro
Reviews.Content: I came to singapore with my dad who was going for his medical treatment and we arrived at the hotel at around 8am. We knew we were testing our luck to see if we can check in early. But to my surprise, the front office staffs were were accomodating and allowed me to check in with my dad immediately with any extra charges. Other hotels i went would have balked at us for checking in so early or would have charged extras. I stayed for 5 nights and overall i found the front office team to be very competent and professional. All of them were very polite and courteous and i defintely would come back here to stay over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, tiny box for a room - would never recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie T
Reviews.Content: My friend from Australia arrived with his family at around 2am at Value Hotel Thomson and were greeted very rudely by the receptionists. And because it was too early to check in, they were, for a lack of a better word, "shoo-ed" away for the night. When my friend asked if the staff could help them get a taxi, they simply advised them to "walk down the road" and wait for one. A big ZERO for customer service and would never recommend this place to anyone. I stayed here for a few nights as well and I can attest to what my friend had said about the place. The room was very small and reeked of an unpleasant smell. Not well ventilated. Perhaps the only good thing about it was the rooftop pool. The "gym" was a small room with one or two gym equipments.

Reviews.Title: “Very Small rooms but Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Kinnoda
Reviews.Content: I was shocked by the small size of the rooms and the dual use of the bathroom as a toilet and a basin, however what the rooms lacked for in square metres, the staff made up for in hospitality, free breakfast and free internet. We were on the same level as the swimming pool and Gym, however the noise was acceptable and it made for easy access for us! An enjoyable stay, within walking distance of the MRT line and would definitely stay again for short trips.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: grant_SK
Reviews.Content: Pretty standard hotel, it is worthwhile for the price, compare most 3 to 4 stars hotels are very high pricy in Singapore. I do not mind to stay their again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service after room cleaning”
Reviews.Author: Jickky
Reviews.Content: Although it is a value hotel, but I never thought the cleaners can put my friends' clothes as floor mat just next to the shoes & floor mat after rooms keeping. This is the 1st time I encountered this problem, I thought Singapore is an advanced country, everything should be in proper training & well handling method on complaining. My friend called to the hotel receptionist & complaint on the above issue, however, the receptionist answered her she don't know about it & ask my friend to pay for laundry services. As I knew, my friend put her clothes & dolls on her bed, but when we came back to the hotel, the things was on the floor!!! Finally, we complaint til the manager came & he said sorry to us & requested us to forget about the human mistake. Unluckily that my friend only brought 1 set of sleeping clothes for this trip & the manager requested her to sleep naked.... I really feel disappointed with all the non-sense answers given by this hotel. It's a terrible trip for me & my friend!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient stop for in-between flights”
Reviews.Author: OWSI
Reviews.Content: Value Hotel Thomson is located along Balastier Road. This is an interesting location since the Singaporean Government is preserving Balastier Road as a heritage area known as the Balastier Heritage Trail. The road is lined by vintage structures that are occupied by restaurants. Walking that road seemed like it is the bah kuh teh (pork ribs simmered in broth of flavored by complex mixture of herbs and spices) capital of Singapore. Bak kuh teh restaurants are next to each other, including the restaurant that claims it originally concocted the bah kuh teh. The hotel is relatively new. The room I was given is a little bit tight but comfortable enough. The bed was comfortable, room was quiet and clean. The bathroom though is really confined such that shower is right next to the toilet so the whole toilet / bathroom gets very wet after a bath. The room amenities include flat screen TV, hot pot with complementary coffee and tea and bottled water and hair blower in addition to the toiletries. The room I had did not have a refrigerator. There is no bed side lamp and no convenience light switch by the bed. One has to stand up to switch off lights. The room I had in the 12th floor has a wide window, but with no view since construction is on-going next door. It could be noisy in that side of the hotel during daytime. Not all rooms have windows. Room with windows cost about $10 more. The front desk staffs are helpful and courteous and I do not mind staying in this hotel during my future overnight stopovers in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “No regret coming back...but”
Reviews.Author: AlvinKyen
Reviews.Content: After my first stay last year, i decided to go back due to this hotel's standard and location. Overall, cleanliness (my top priority) is commendable. everything in the room works as it should. The only unpleasant incident was receiving a call at 10.30am on Sunday from the front desk telling us that we have been given the WRONG room type. Unless it was an absolute emergency, please train your staff that it is absolutely NOT RIGHT and rude to call (over an issue which was your staff's fault) your guest at such hour. Why can you just slip a note through the door? P/s : please find a way to install hangers in the shower room though!

Reviews.Title: “Kinda of cramped up”
Reviews.Author: Clatonh
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok, not that great, the room were very very small, especially the bathrooms. Only one person can use the bathroom, other person cant use it even if they want to use the wash-basin. The location is great, 15 min walk to the MRT station. Dont ask the hotel folks they will tell you to take a cab, just go to the MRT and you can travel across Singapore. When confused ask the ppl around.. they are very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with excellent staffs”
Reviews.Author: JacobsSimmons
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel with some apprehension due to the fact i read some reviews about how small the room is. But when i checked in with my fiancee, i was pleasantly suprised by the size of it. It was more than adequate for a couple staying and i am quite a big sized guy myself.You cannot expect to pay such a cheap price for a room and expect the size of a presidential suite in return. The front office staffs were very obliging and affable with all my requests and questions about how to travel and where to visit the sights of Singapore and were generally very courteous as well. I will defintely come back to stay here again and would definitely recommend this hotel to all my friends back in the US. Kudos to the staffs for making my stay a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny budget rooms: deficient shower, unfriendly staff, no breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Joseph C
Reviews.Content: Value Hotel Thomson is, as its name implies, a budget hotel, so don't expect amenities. It was the most spartan hotel room I'd ever seen, as well as the second-tiniest, so much so that I had a hard time finding somewhere to place my umbrella so it could dry. The bed was definitely on the firm side and had only one coverlet, though fortunately the room's thermostat worked. The walls were thin, so I couldn't have slept if I hadn't brought earplugs. My three biggest complaints, however, related to the bizarre shower, the unfriendly staff, and the absence of the promised breakfast. The shower is merely a showerhead in the bathroom: no shower curtain, no enclosure of any kind, and the water covered the entire bathroom floor before reaching a drain in the far corner. Why would they design such a deficient shower? They don't provide soap either, so I was glad I brought my own, though they do provide bath gel and shower. The staff were very unfriendly and were unable or unwilling to answer basic questions. They also don't have any maps or tourist brochures at the hotel, nor do the staff seem to realize why tourists would want and expect such things. So be sure to grab a map and some brochures before you leave the airport because I found only one tourist kiosk in all of Singapore (on Orchard Road). Perhaps the staff haven't traveled outside Singapore and therefore aren't familiar with showers or hotel desks in the rest of the world. Finally, I had reserved my room and prepaid for it using a well-known online third-party company; I paid extra for breakfast to be included. Upon arrival, I discovered that there was no restaurant in the hotel, and to get the included breakfast I needed a coupon from the front desk, but they had no record that I had paid for it, and the surly staffer didn't have any interest in trying to confirm it with the online company. So I was quite irritated to be charged extra for the non-existent breakfast. The room included a water-boiling pot (look for its base inside the desk drawer); a television with several channels, though I found only one in English; and two complimentary bottles of water, replenished daily. There wasn't a refrigerator. The hotel certainly doesn't have amenities such as a gym, pool, business center, or room service. There are two Internet terminals in the lobby, both of which charge by the minute. There are no tourist attractions in the neighborhood of the hotel, though there is a small convenience store around the corner. The hotel is about 8 to 10 minutes' walk from the nearest subway stop, the Novena MRT station, which is by far the easiest way to travel within Singapore. Although the Value Hotel Thomson is located on Balestier Road, be advised that there is also a different hotel called the Value Hotel Balestier, so don't confuse the two. I wouldn't stay there again, and it's an adequate value only by comparison with even more expensive hotels elsewhere in Singapore. However, if you lower your expectations and consider it a backpacker venue rather than a mid-range hotel, you might be content with it.

Reviews.Title: “unimpressed :(”
Reviews.Author: SB1102
Reviews.Content: i went there with my family for a week-long vacation... to sum up the experience, it wasn't impressive +ves- the rooms are very tidy and the french window makes for a nice view. reception staff was very courteous and helpful. -ves- the rooms here are very very small, rather cramped for water, they provide only self-branded bottled water and charge a significant amount for it hotel is located quite distant from city centre and most of the tourist locations. further, it is located in a residential area. so finding traveller's conveniences like restaurants etc. was quite a trouble. overall, i wouldn't advise anyone to stay in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Every space counts - very small bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy C
Reviews.Content: Was looking for an affordable place in Singapore while staying away from the red light district and "ho-tels" Stayed here last week and reserved for a window room. Upon check-in, we noticed that the window was just a hole in the wall with glass facing the other side of the hotel (inner unit). We quickly complained and requested for a change in room or be charged the tariff of the standard non-window room. We were given a new window room. The window is 6 times bigger than the hole in the wall and the room has a ledge near the window where we could put our suitcase and other things. You have to be creative as you have to adjust to this 10sqm room with a 2sqm bathroom. Every inch or cm of space counts. Can't take a bath one after the other as the bath is already flooded asfter the first person takes a bath. Room is clean and decent. Partitions in between room was made of plywood. You can hear people talking, joking and walking in the hallway, Bed is on the hard side, Toiletries, towels (a little worn), coffee and tea (3 in 1) provided. Far from MRT (20 minutes walk), you have to take a five minute walk to the bus stop and another 5 minute bus ride. Outside the hotel are 2 convenience stores, a fine dining resto and several open-air eateries. Quite near the community mall.

Reviews.Title: “Plusses and minusses”
Reviews.Author: MortenL
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel for a long weekend in Singapore. It was not particularly cheap, but was located next door to a friends place, and we'd meet up with him every day. The rooms are small, but this was expected. They were clean, cleaned every day, and had air-con. We had a room without windows (by choice since this is cheaper), and it did get a bit stuffy in there. The toilet/shower is small, and everything will get wet when you take a shower. There is a flatscreen TV in the room, but we didn't use it so I can't say anything about the channels. The breakfast is in a restaurant next door, and was ok for the type of hotel. This is all well and good, but the bad part was the noise. This hotel seems to attract people who want to stand outside their rooms shouting at 0200 in the night, and 0600 in the morning. The hotel design with long bare corridors doesn't help as noise travels very far. If the guy on the other side of the wall is snoring, you'll hear it clearly too. The hotel staff are friendly, and dealt with any small problem we had (and we didn't have any big ones). Getting into Singapore city is easy with the good bus system the have, or you can walk for 10 minutes to reach a MRT station.. If you sleep like a log, this hotel might suit you well, but I'd not stay there again purely because of the noise level.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean”
Reviews.Author: On_Holiday_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here early November for 4 nights and although it was relatively cheap, it was very small for 2 people twin-sharing a room. the bathroom was quite small and the shower was 'open plan' so everytime you had a shower, the toilet would get wet. the reception staff were civil but unhelpful when we asked them about getting directions to the main city centre. If you want a clean place to stay thats cheap then i would recommend here but if you speak english then you may not get as much help as youd like. Also, i would recommend going across the road on Balestier Road if you need to use the internet- its only $1SGD per hour compared with the hotel rate of over $4 for half an hour.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap as the name suggests but in a wrong way”
Reviews.Author: BobokumarM
Reviews.Content: 'Value' apparently means 'cheap' to the staff of this hotel. You won't find any hotel staff as rude as in this hotel. This might be a cheap option but look around and you will find many other cheaper hotels with better service. The room was very small, with not enough space for two; don't expect a chair or table; a mini frdige or an iron box is out of question. And yeah, switching on/off light was a big pain - with no bedisde switch. The matchbox size bathroom had no shower curtain, hand towel, handwash... and there was no place to keep toiletries I brought myself. The floor was flooded in minutes of shower. Since there was no mat to dry the feet, when I come out, the room would turn into an extension of the bathroom. Someone pointed out there is no sound proof - indeed so. We could hear guests walking in the corrdor, irritatingly loud. Not a place to sleep and rest. On the rudeness of the staff, we felt treated like a cheap airline passenger - no smiles, no welcoming greetings, no thank-you's... we would approach the front desk only to be met with silence from the staff behind the desk. Avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Kinda chic, compact & cosy”
Reviews.Author: JazzieTea
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel while browsing through its website, and was attracted to its neat pictures with clean sheets and clean bathroom (well, who doesn't, right?). And I was quite prepared for the fact that the room would be small, in view of the budget and the roomrate. So we walked about 7 minutes from the Novena MRT station to this hotel, after getting directions from a local there. I liked the fact that Singapore has wide pedestrian paths which make walking and running travelers-friendly. We arrived at the hotel after spotting the sign of the building and checked in as expected. The hotel interior was kinda chic, but small. The staff was not really friendly, but the check-in process was smooth nevertheless. The room that we got was small and compact, but really clean. I adored the large bay window where you could sit beside it on the elevated window-sitting area, and we could put all of our personal belongings and knick knacks from the trip. The cupboard and the makup desk were very tiny and I was amazed by the space that was built to cater for this 2 pieces of furniture. Though it's a budget hotel, it still provided 2 bottles of drinking water everyday throughout our stay to quench our thirst, and I think this was essential because one would get hydrated easily while travelling and exploring the wonders of the city. More importantly, the bathroom was clean and quite new-looking, chic even, due to its squarish basin and neutral-tone wall & floor tiles. Although the whole area would be wet after showering, I still gave credit to its simplicity and cleanliness. Accessibility to the city and other parts of Singapore was not a problem, as buses easily stop by the hotel to pick up passengers to their destinations. If bus is not your thing, then just walk briskly for 7 minutes (or normal walking for 12 minutes) to the nearest MRT station (ie. Novena MRT station) where you can easily access to most parts of Singapore. In a nutshell, this is a recommended hotel to go to if you have a budget constraint. The hotel has other branches too, namely Value Hotel Balestier and Value Hotel Nice. I haven't tried both of them so I don't have any comment to share.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, but sub-standard staff”
Reviews.Author: tarnsdubya
Reviews.Content: For a budget hotel , I have to admit that this hotel has a nice appearance, looks very modern. The staff however, tend to be unsmiling and do the bare minimum. They come across as if they really disike their job. Towards the end of our stay we had a really unpleasant smell in our bathroom. An unsmiling housekeeper came up to fix it, and sprayed half a can of air freshener which meant it triggered my friends asthma and we had to have the door open. Fortunately the smell did eventually disappear. Had a room with a window that was right in the path of construction workers working on a building directly opposite (I am aware that we could have tried to ask to move, but it was just too much hassle). The final annoyance was the night before we left when the guy at the front desk tried to charge me ten Singaporean dollars to post 5 postcards to NZ. (When Hotel 81 Dickson had only charged $2 for the same service). Eventually posted them at Changi airport for $2.50. Would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Universal Studio Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Trasero
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel a month ago. Front desk: Polite Location: 10 min to the nearest station. Transportation: Taxi everywhere Room: Small (Not as expected from the pics)

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean”
Reviews.Author: BennyLD
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice, first time for 4 nights in the cheapest room with a window, second time for one night in room without window. Pretty cheap by Singapore standards, small swimming pool is included with the price and was quite nice. Staff is helpful enough. Rooms are small but clean, beds and bedsheets are comfortable and look new. Location is not the best, but Singapore is small and you can easily get around by metro and (tip!) bus. Bus station is right outside and busses from there go just about anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel...but there are other better budget hotels at a cheaper price”
Reviews.Author: g0lf_vacati0ns
Reviews.Content: Was here for a night. I chose this hotel as it was within budget and I thought considered quite new (recently built). Check-in staff was ok...not very friendly but they 'do their job and nothing more...LOL' We got a standard room, the cheapest room without windows. The room was very small but that did not turn me off...as I understood that 'you get what you pay for'. Room had no carpet....queen size bed was alright...not very comfortable but good enough to sleep. Pillows quality was like 6/10....sheets were clean. Room has a small LCD TV mounted on the wall....no sofa/seating area. Wardrobe area is pathetic... The worst part is the toilet. It is very very very small. It has a sink, toilet seat and shower area all cramped within that small space. There is no separate shower area...which means when you take a shower, the toilet seat gets wet...it also means if you have just finished a shower, the whole toilet floor is wet...so even if you just wanna walk into the toilet to wash your hands or whatever, your feet gets wet. They only provide 2 bath towels...no face towels, no hand towels, no floor towel....so basically your feet is wet and you walk out into your bed area with wet feet! Standard amenities like shampoo and shower gel is given. No toothbrush, no body lotion whatsoever. Shower cap is also given. This is a budget accommodation and I would only recommend it to SOLO travelers due to its size. Because of the size of the toilet, I would not return. There are other CHEAPER budget hotels in singapore that has bigger bathrooms with more amenities and separate shower space.

Reviews.Title: “aveage, ok lah! lol”
Reviews.Author: girfriend000
Reviews.Content: stayed here 2 years ago around Sep 2009 when this hotel was still quite new. i dont have any bad experience here, the room was ok. dont choose the standard room or the smallest room its very small. we chose the other type of room, i forgot if its deluxe or whatever. downside: location and a staff who made an occupied room as a show room as he showed a guest's room to us as an example of their room while the guest was out. very bad. we even saw the guest's scattered stuff in his room. other than that i can't say anything more. the housekeeping staff were good but i think they cant speak english.. the breakfast buffet is just a very very simple but quite affordable. for 7 or 12 sgd its eat-all-you-can.. :D

Reviews.Title: “Hotel should be closed down by health and safety. FILTHY, DAMP rooms with no windows.”
Reviews.Author: Loopie L
Reviews.Content: The worst place I have EVER stayed. Shocking from start to finish. Stayed here for 3 nights in August 2011. There was no window in my room and the room smelt awfully of damp. No Air conditioning. Damp all over the walls, the ceilings and the "Air conditioning" unit was just a hole in the ceiling with a grid covering it. I asked to be moved to another room and was told it would be the same. When I went in to view the "new" room it was as they had said, exactely the same, in fact worse. The shower in the bathroom is right beside the toilet with no shower curtain! I do not know how this hotel are getting away with this considering the standard of hotels in Singapore. Its not exactely as if this hotel is very cheap! When I returned home after my 3 night stay my clothes absolutely stank of damp.Totally unhelpful, unfriendly reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “Economy Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: vijayakumarc123
Reviews.Content: Check in was easy, showed my reservation paper to friendly (not impressed though) front staff , about 15 minutes every thing ready to enter first economy stay in Singapore. Some staff helped me to go room. The room was small but enough for single and still manageable for two. Compact bathroom. I had offered window room (I heard there are few rooms without it!). Room had no Wi-fi but still you have option for LAN internet but my unfortunate even that was not working when i been there.! Thank to god, there was a near internet cafe which i used for some online stuff! There is near by snooker game room (outside hotel) where i spent some hours to kill my boredom. Nearly 5-10 minutes there bus stop for access to city. About food, I found an Indian style hotel about 15-20 minutes on the same street which made quite happy, another happy news was there was multiplex theater about another couple of minutes walk that is Shaw Balestier. Why this made me special because i had chance to see Tollywood movie "Orange" on first day. Totally it is value for money hotel.!

Reviews.Title: “Feedback”
Reviews.Author: Clive G
Reviews.Content: This is a budget hotel about 4km from city centre. Rooms are small, lowest standard has no windows. Rooms clean and aircon works well. Has a reasonable pool. Ensuite is tiny but clean. Do not book breakfast as this is done at adjoining cafe. All cooked food was cold no matter what time you had breakfast. There is a small market in Thomson St opposite hospital - locals eat here and it is cheap. Easy 10 minute walk to Novena MRT station which will get you into city centre in 10 minutes for about $1.10S after refund of ticket deposit. MRT is easy to use and will get you most places. Hotel charges you to call a taxi. Internet $10/day WiFi or $4/half hr in foyer.

Reviews.Title: “the rooms are very small!!!”
Reviews.Author: daviworldtour
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very clean in good location and very cheap, the only defects are the tiny little room and you can not turn off the air conditioning every morning was like being in a wax frigoe not even the possibility to open the window because they do not wax ) .. and also the internet is free use of swimming pool located on the seventh floor! good trip!!!!

Reviews.Title: “WHAT TO EXPECT AT VALUE HOTEL SINGAPORE”
Reviews.Author: Michael H
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Singapore where I spent 2 nights at the Value Hotel. Here is what you need to know before you make any reservations at this hotel. It's a budget hotel in every sense of the word, from the lobby, to the elevator which is very small, to the rooms. When I walked into the room, I was surprised at how small the room was. We could barely find space for two small pieces of luggage. Two people can't possibly walk in that room at the same time, one has to sit on the bed if the other one needs to walk, even to go to the bathroom. Speaking of the bathroom, it's also very small. It's one of those all in one bath, shower, rolled into one, very basic. The room is also very noisy, you can hear just about everything happening when people walk in the hallway or open their door. NO FREE BREAKFAST. If you spend most of your time taking pictures, shopping away from the Hotel, you might find it to be just what you are looking for. If you consider the price of a 5 star hotel in center town which can run into hundreds of dollars per night, Value hotel is as the name described.. If you decide to stay there, try to use the bus to go to town. It's very easy to take a bus (Bus 131 or 145) which costs about SPD1.60 per person to the center of town. The bus is air conditioned and it also allows you to see what else is in the city. A taxi ride would cost you 17.00 dollars in the day time for the same distance. There's plenty of restaurants around the hotel to challenge your pallet. I was able to take advantage of the FREE wifi internet connection from the room although they have PC's downstairs for you to use free of charge. If you decide to use the wifi Just ask the desk clerk for the password before you go to your room if not, you will have to go back to the front desk to get it, they won't give it to you over the phone. If you need a taxi, just tell the staff and they will call for one which takes about 5 minutes. NO TIPPING NECESSARY.

Reviews.Title: “will not come back again”
Reviews.Author: Ivan K
Reviews.Content: we stay a night at Singapore after Bintan's trip, and book this Value hotel Thomson in a rush, as we don't have the booking number on hand, the front desk lady is not friendly for help and talk very rude. Her attitude is very bad and not acceptable. we complain to her manager then she scare and talk with better attitude, but never say "SORRY", will NEVER book this hotel again, other hotel close to Novena MRT is also around the same price, why stay at this one. 1) rude front desk lady. 2) the room is very tiny for 2 person better go for quality hotel on the same street. 3) far distance for Novena MRT to Hotel. (15mins) Will blow up your mood in the whole trip, God damn it.

Reviews.Title: “The Not-So True To Its Name”
Reviews.Author: baskoroadiwiyono
Reviews.Content: Just stayed there during Raya holiday with family of 3 (1 infant). True to its name, it's a budget hotel for those looking for spending-more-time-outside-the-room-in-Singapore. We stayed in a superior twin. It was quite small we even have to 'merge' the twin beds just to feel a 'slight more space' for our luggage & baby stroller. Not to mention the bathroom; a shower of course. About 8 TV & 2 radio channels, not much of in-room entertainment you can expect. However, for a budget stay (or should I say a 'value' stay), it has a small gym space with 2 exercise bikes & 1 exercise/ pilates ball. Plus, a swimming pool with enough size to maintain your heart at its normal rate while enjoying many of Singapore scrumptious treats. It's also best If you want some more 'exercises', since you need to take a walk for 15-20 minutes (leisure pace) from the hotel to the nearest MRT station (Novena station). Might as well take a cab from there to places. If you're traveling with 3 or more people, you may find that taking a cab to the heart of the city is not that expensive compare with taking MRT -consider the time, the walk, the practicality etc.

Reviews.Title: “Bring Some Earplugs!!”
Reviews.Author: michaeldouglascasten
Reviews.Content: This place was NOISY! I was not prepared on the first night and didnt sleep well at all. Bought some earplugs the next and it was perfect. There is a problem with sound isolation in this place but if your willing to wear earplugs to sleep then this place is a great budget hotel. Pool was great and people at the desk were more than willing to help. Wouldnt go back to the eater '2nd Kitchen' was overpriced and pretty average you can find much cheaper and better food around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Awkward location, nothing special as a hotel and a bit over-priced”
Reviews.Author: nzbear
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights. It's a newish hotel and well maintained. It's about 15-20 minutes walk from Novena MRT (and Novena Square) so not terribly convenient to anything. In fact an odd place to have built a hotel. Small rooms although bathroom not bad. No fridge. No hand towels. No bath mat. No breakfast included. TV has a limited range of channels. No radio or clock. Some design flaws - you have to get out of bed to put on a light! Corridors are not carpeted so noise from the corridors can be a problem. A bit over-priced for what you get and where it is. I had a room wtihout windows - not a problem as the air-con is fairly good. However you cannot adjust the air-con yourself as it seems set to one universal setting. Internet in the lobby is $4 for half an hour - nearby you can get an hour for $1 at an internet cafe. Regrettably some customers don't seem to understand what "No Smoking" signs mean. It's a busy hotel which lead me to suspect you can rent rooms for short periods! Overall OK for a night or two, but for $10 more you could get a better placed hotel elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin - good, clean, value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Haralambos
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in July and found the hotel very comfortable. Comparable to a Travelodge or Premier Inn. The hotel is new, very clean, well run and cheap for Singapore. The location is just 10 mins walk from the nearest metro station, in a central but quiet part of Singapore, only a couple of stops from the main shopping area (taxis are also easy to find and the area is safe to walk around late at night). We didn't have any of our meals at the hotel but there are several "hawker" centres around the hotel where you can get tasty local food for a few dollars (the Chicken Rice outlet near Novena MRT station was excellent). We only really used the hotel as a base to sleep, although the pool on the roof was nice for a morning swim. We also got free Wifi, although it was a bit of a hassle requesting a new code every day. Bathroom is compact, so does get a little wet after a shower but this is not really an issue. The rooms are quite small so don't expect much storage space - not a problem if you don't mind living out of your suitcase for a few days. Staff were helpful and allowed us to keep our bags in storage at the hotel at no cost for a 5 day period between our stays. Overall, an excellent option for those wanting a reliable, clean and economic stay in an easily accessible location.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best you'll get in the budget category”
Reviews.Author: Chaucer
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Singapore for four nights in August 2011. I normally stay in low cost hotels but even with TA, I was hard pressed to find much suitable in Singapore, which seems quite expensive when it comes to accommodation. The chains Hotel 81 and Fragrance seems cheaper than Value, but I was dissuaded by the many negative comments about their uncomfortable beds. This hotel was not the cheapest and could be described as one of the pricier ones at the low end of the market. All the same, most hotels cost a lot more. I got a superior room. Over all, I was satisfied with the hotel. It ticked all my essential boxes, like: 1. clean 2. you could block out street light with quality curtains at night 3. room was quiet at night 4. bed was very comfortable 5. plenty of good hot water when I showered 6. good air con. It seems unfortunate that in Singapore such modest expectations don't come with modest price tags. The good news though is that apart from hotel prices, everything else in Singapore is very reasonably priced. As for location, it's not walkable to the main sights, but you can catch frequent buses near the hotel or take taxis. Buy an EziCard (for transport) from the many 7/11 stores nearby. Cafes and restaurants abound in the local area, so it's fine for relaxing after a hard day sight seeing. My verdict is that the hotel is value for money (by Singapore standards) but if your budget can stretch a bit further then staying in Chinatown would be better in tems of access to attractions and ease of public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Small spaces but affordable price”
Reviews.Author: Ewaizel
Reviews.Content: You will have only a bed, small table and that's it. The restroom is 1.3 meters per side and includes all 3 services. No restaurant and the one beside is terrible. Novena MTR station is 800 meters away. It is clean and the price ok compared to the city average.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: SouCross
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the reviews from tripadvisor members and I am absolutely happy with the choice I made. The hotel..... Location... it is ok... about 20 min taxi ride to Singapore's CBD -- SGD 12 (taxi). The neigborhood is good. with plenty of restaurants to try different stuff.... there is a small restaurant next to the hotel... slightly more expensive than other ones... good food though. Room.... small but ok.. if you want to stay the entire day in the room then...OK.. it may be a little bit too small. I only got back at the hotel late in the evening and therefore very good size for me. .. The room has no minibar. It does have a big tv with some channels in english. Toilet.... No bath. Only shower.. but the entire bathroom is the shower... therefore if you take one you will make the entire floor wet.. But that is not a big deal. Swimming pool.... very good. located on the 7th floor... is about 15m by 10 m. 1.2 m deep. Very good... very refreshing... you have to try it. Staff is very helpful.... and I got free internet because I booked the hotel through internet. (I did... but I can not guarantee it will happen to every one)...HIGHLY RECOMMENDED PLACE TO STAY IN SINGAPORE.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, good location”
Reviews.Author: sandrinagracia
Reviews.Content: We stayed there during our family vacation on June 2011. The room was small, yet it was clean, also the bathroom. The staffs were quite helpful, though not too friendly. If you plan to go to Universal Studios S'pore, they provide shuttle service from/to the hotel. The nearest MRT station was Novena, approximately 20' walking distance. But it was so close with Thomson bus stop, you can practically go to anywhere by bus. There were also several eating places near the hotel, with very low price. Overall, we were satisfied. Low cost, good location, standard service (though not excellence, it is the best you can expect with a budget hotel!).

Reviews.Title: “OK for just spending a night”
Reviews.Author: dketaki1
Reviews.Content: Very small rooms and location wise also it is little away from the heartland. I generally like to taste different cuisines but singaporean food was a disappointment. The hotel is not very near to the Novena train station and you need to walk a lot or take a bus to Novena. If you would like to have indian food then it is beter to stay near the little India/Farrer park area.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price”
Reviews.Author: jonathankatz
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel after finding a really nice deal for it on Expedia (65% of the normal price). Even though I was staying on a discount, I still got really good service. The staff was courteous, and quite helpful. The room is cozy, but comfortable. Everything is extremely clean. It should be noted, though, that the internet is quite slow and rather pricy.

Reviews.Title: “Clean place to sleep for the night.”
Reviews.Author: BadDogChico
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very clean, basic, and no-frills. I was expecting that from the reviews. The pool was surprisingly nice. I was not very impressed with the service of the staff at all. I called the hotel the day of our reservation to let them know we would not be checking in until at least 2 AM due to major travel delays. I was rudley told that check in was not until 3. I had to explain twice more to the person that I was not checking early. I was checking in late and wanted to make sure they held our room. The message was finally understood. When we finally got there at 2 AM, we were coldly greeted by front desk. They gave us our key, and to my surprise did not ask for a credit card. Oh well, I had given it to them on the web site and figured they must have a different system then other hotels. We went to room after two days of non-stop travel. Exausted, we started to unwind and get ready for bed. At 2:45 our phone rings. It is front desk informing me I did not give them my credit card. They said this rather harshly, as if I was trying to get away with a free room, and had not given it to them on purpose. I was told I needed to bring it down immediately to front desk. Ick. I dragged my PJ clad self down again. In the AM, we went down to ask for a map of the general area. Was once again rudely and snobbishly treated. They did not have a map, nor would they help with directions any where. We paid $150 for the room after all taxes were put on bill. I guess this was a value. The only plus side was the clean rooms and the good location. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If I was on a tight budget I will stay there ...”
Reviews.Author: TasmaniaDen
Reviews.Content: If we were on a tight budget I will stay there and organize my own Bfast in our room or go to a mall ... Rooms are small but have most you need ...but think there is not room to put a notebook ( must smaller then a laptop) we had to use the bed ...but for the price we got with free internet , it was great value ...Only complaint Aircom ; it is using a centralized system and you can't regulate in your room the temperature as you like it ...too hot for us and feeling so much enclosed ...Staff were nice and friendly , pool was great .....they hold your luggage's all day for free if you have a late flight ...bus stop a few step away in either directions ( great ) Forget the breakfast at 10 dollars NO European or Australian Health inspector will pass it .. in K2 ; I have been in the Tourism / hotel industry for over 44 years ...Chatterbox in the Mandarin Hotel mall has a great breakfast ... If you can't take the heat stay away from SG .....

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: maymay777
Reviews.Content: Reasonably cheap (slightly under AUD100 per night) and located in amongst some famous Singaporean eateries and restaurants (apparently some people queue up around the block for the specialties). It was only a short stopover for me so did not manage to try any of the food. 5-10 mins walk to the Novena MRT, felt longer in the hot sun. I would suggest just taking a cab as they're reasonably cheap and more comfortable. Room was basic and well-equipped (package came with complimentary Wifi). Bathroom was very tiny and you basically have to shower over the toilet. Comfortable for one. Walls were thin and room was located near a cleaner's store room which meant it was extra noisy. I was a heavy sleeper so it didn't bother me too much. Service was splotchy. Some guys at reception were absolute noobs who got everything wrong, while a couple of the experienced ones were on the ball. All in all, no frills hotel that does the job for a short stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bobby_Lam
Reviews.Content: The room is clean, however, it's really really small. And so does the bathroom. The room wall is really thin so that you can almost here any noise from the next room. The staff is not friendly and quite lazy. The hotel locate quite far from the nearest MRT station, hence, getting around with public transportation is quite difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: swhnld
Reviews.Content: The Thomson value hotel is exactly what it names suggest. Good value for money. The hotel is not expensive, and they save costs. However, it is not a bad place to sleep. The hotel room was small. It consisted of a comfortable bed a TV and small table hanging on the wall. The Window was very deep so you could put your suitcases in front of it. Behind the bed was a table mounted on the wall, and you had to sit on the bed to use it. The bathroom was tiny as well, with no shower curtain (no place for it), but all the things like douche gel, shampoo, spare comb, etc. was there. The room would be cleaned thoroughly every day. Also every day there were 2 bottles of water in the room, and airco was working fine. The hotel has some entertainment with a gym and pool, but we did not use any of that, we just used it to sleep. The hotel can offer asian breakfast across the street. We choose to walk a bit down the road to a shopping center where we could eat more European style breakfast. The hotel is just outside the area on the tourist maps, but in 20 minutes walking you can be in either Little India or Orchart Road. Or you take a taxi, which are reasonably affordable there with a start price of 3 Singapore dollar and 20 cent per kilometer on top. Public transport is also available, and we calculated that taxi is less expensive with 3 or more persons, otherwise public transport is cheaper. For taxi it is handy to have a address of the hotel as there are multiple value hotels in Singapore. Also, although they say all taxi's accept credit card, you cannot be sure, better to have cash with you. We had arguments 2 times where at arrival credit cards where not accepted. We usually stay in more expensive hotels, however this was not a bad experience for a budget hotel at all. We might look at something similar in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: OHerron
Reviews.Content: Small box like room with view of building site and window didn't open. Quite clean and reasonable value. Not central so public transport is a must. Staff not very helpful or friendly. We'll try elsewhere on our return to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “A tiny cave”
Reviews.Author: Trek360
Reviews.Content: Rooms are basic and tiny but descent. Our taxi driver from the airport had a hard time looking of it. The hotel's location is far from the touristy city center. Around and across the block is a 5-7 minute walk to the nearest bus stop and around 2 bus stops away from the nearest MRT station. The rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable. The hotel is relatively new, so for for the price it's acceptable. Unfortunately our room did not come with a window. We had to check our watches from time to time just to check if it's morning or not. If you're claustrophobic, this hotel is not for you. I would suggest looking for a hotel with a bus stop within the block so you wouldn't have to cross traffic light and wait around, better yet try looking for a hotel near a MRT station it's makes your touristic experience a lot better. If your stay in Singapore is longer than ours, stay here and save a buck, but if your like us, just a short 2 night's stay, find a hotel elsewhere a look for a hotel nearer to the actual hot spots and save the time of traveling and spend more time exploring the beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it”
Reviews.Author: Fred H
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be great value for money. Staff were courteous and helpful. I had a Superior Room and have to admit the bed was the best I have slept in for years. As a solo traveller the bathroom didn't present any problems nor did the size of the room. The MRT isn't so far away, and, like the bus stop in Thompson Road, is an easy short walk from the hotel. Although there was no fridge in the room, the restaurant and shop adjoining sell cold drinks and obligingly supplied me with a cup of ice on request (to help with my duty free alcohol). I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “As minimal as you can get - not even a window!”
Reviews.Author: Paris12
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for its low price since I just needed a place to sleep between two flights. This is what this hotel is, just a place to sleep. First of all, half of the rooms have no windows. Furniture is minimal - no closet, no bedside table or lamp (you have to get up to turn off the light), no place to lay your luggage, a TV that does not face the bed and does not rotate. The bathroom is also minimal - tiny, no toilet paper rolls but individual sheets instead. No soap bars. A small, square sink. The shower is just a shower head hanging on the wall and a hole in the ground - no curtain, no bulkhead, not even a recess in the floor. Expect to transform the bathroom in a swimming pool within seconds! Room design is modern and looking nice. It was rather clean too although there was long black hair on the floor and in the bathroom. The wall was dirty with scratches and shoe marks. Good water pressure and AC unit working well. Staff was ok but customers were noisy until late in the night (people running, yelling, having conversations in the corridor... until way after 1am). Next time I will consider the airport transit hotel - sure this hotel is cheap but when you add 40 or 60 SGD for a round trip taxi, I'm sure you can afford better at Changi.

Reviews.Title: “Tiniest Rooms ever seen”
Reviews.Author: ZenobiaDsouza
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in April '11. I was shocked to see how small the room & bathroom was. we had a toddler with us & we just coudnt spend any time in the hotel becasue there was just no space to move around. Even arranging the bags was a challenge.

Reviews.Title: “When we returned to the rom, found the door was fully opened”
Reviews.Author: ArthurHK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from Jul 4th to 6th. On Jul 5th, we left hotel around 10:30am and found door of our room was fully opened when we returned to hotel around 8:30pm. We called the hotel reception immediately and they sent a staff, Paul to our room and said they’ll check the CCTV in corridor and give us a reply. Then we went out for dinner and returned to hotel around 10:00pm and asked Paul in the reception what they found. Paul restated they’ll give us a reply that night or next morning before we check out. However, no one from the hotel said sorry or apologizes to us! Next morning, when we’ re checking out, the reception lady said thank you to us! They totally forgot that they’ve to give us an answer!!! We reminded the lady and she asked her mananger(I think he is) to come to us. Firstly, the manager didn’t say sorry. He just explained the chamber’s maid forgot to close the door when she’s cleaning the room and they gave her a warning letter. They’ll train their staff to avoid same issue for other guests. They should have trained their staffs the first day to avoid this kind of serious problem!!! The manager finally apologized reluctantly after we told him we’ll complain them. He also offered upgrading our room if we stay in their hotel again, but we are sure we won’t stay there again. In our communication with the hotel staffs, I can’t feel they consider this as a serious problem. They even didn’t prepare to give us a reply proactively. We’ve travelled in quite a lot of places and never have this kind of mistake in our stays and didn’t expect this will happen in Singapore! Our room’s door is fully opened for many hours, everybody can come in and take anything they want or put something like drugs in our luggage. We spent lot of time to check if we’ve lost anything. It’s lucky that nothing lost. However, we felt very unsecure in our stay after that and we lost time to check our luggage. We came to Singapore for fun, not checking our luggage! The hotel must take this kind of mistakes seriously! They should install security system in the door, so if the door is not closed in a period of time, it’ll be notified. This is very common in other hotels! Again, they should do this in the first day, not suggested by us.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Basic”
Reviews.Author: perryw
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in early March, 2011, as my flight arrived in Singapore late in the evening and I thought this would be a good budget option, based on reviews on Tripadvisor. The reception attendant and check-in process was reasonable but I wouldn’t describe it as being friendly, I haven’t actually encountered any Singaporean reception staff with friendly dispositions at budget hotels in Singapore (the foreign staff are usually much friendlier). The first thing I noticed about the hotel room was its very basic setup. I had previously stayed at the Aqueen Lavender, which is also a budget hotel in Singapore but the Value Hotel has even more basic rooms. There was no safe, no mini-fridge and not much else in the room either, which was very small. However, the room had a relatively high-quality LCD TV. The sitting area consisted of a ledge next to the window, it was actually quite a nice place to sit. The whole room conveyed a sense of being low-maintenance and of not requiring a large amount of effort to turn-around. It was a very basic room, even by budget hotel standards. The room was clean and had a good shower facility, which was Grohe-branded. However, the shower was not separated from the toilet area, which was something that the Aqueen Lavender was able to provide. The room had a window and a view onto the street but it wasn’t anything special. The noise insulation from the corridor appeared to be a problem, as there was significant noise leakage evident but then again, usually there wouldn’t be too many people in the corridors at any one time. The bed was firm but comfortable and the comforters had an appropriate level of thickness, which was just as well because it appeared that the aircon switch could not be turned off completely, meaning that the aircon could not be switched off (there is a video of this on my youtube hotels channel at www.youtube.com/AllHotelrooms). The pool was very large and there were good views from the rooftop pool. The gym, however, was quite small. The hotel is located in a reasonable location because at night there were still a few places to eat closeby but these were only serving Asian food. Being a budget hotel in Singapore, it was located in a slightly seedy area, which seems to be an unavoidable issue when staying in Singaporean budget hotels. Overall, the hotel was quite basic and on the issue of value, it didn't seem to deliver much of that (the rate was still around S$100). Note: A video of the hotel room appears on my youtube hotels page at: www.youtube.com/AllHotelrooms

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Price, Clean Place”
Reviews.Author: itsmeDJ
Reviews.Content: Well the hotel was great, singaporean front desk officers doesnt smile at all, but filipino front desk staff was great though, helped us with directions. even made a print out of how to go to our destination. Rooms were small, really small, but not bad if you intend to be outdoors during the day. The place is cozy, clean bathroom and clean sheets. be sure to request for a room with bay windows during the reservation. A bit far from the nearest MRT station which is Novena but if you are into a 15 minute walk then this should not be a problem at all. Nothing special with the pool and the gym is relatively small, more like a mini gym. But I think its all worth it, not bad after all.

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate for us”
Reviews.Author: botemanAuckland
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here on our way to Vietnam. The room was small and basic but ok The staff were great giving us good advice on how best to get into town (bus, number and price, train MRT station etc) and back. The swimming pool was a bonus. Value for money was good especially compared with other hotels in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, easy access to MRT”
Reviews.Author: MattAndSamEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over a weekend and it was all we needed - the hotel is clean and modern, the room isn't huge but that wasn't a problem as you don't spend too much time in the hotel anyway with Singapore to explore! The MRT is a 10 minute walk down the road and the area feels very safe and clean so we weren't worried about the walk at 11pm from the MRT back to the hotel. Would highly recommend this as it's considerably cheaper than some of the city-centre hotels. The only slight 'but' is that the corridors are all tiled, not carpeted, and some guests had a (annoying & inconsiderate!!) habit of chatting in the corridor late at night before entering their rooms: the tiles means no sound is soaked up and their conversation echoes up and down the corridor very loudly, which woke us up. A simple sign put up by the management to please be quiet in the corridors after, say 10pm, could hopefully address this, it's just common sense really.

Reviews.Title: “Great for budget travelers!”
Reviews.Author: dyupe_moe
Reviews.Content: After comparing prices and reviews, my wife and I decided to book at Value Hotel Thomson for our 4 day trip to Singapore. The price was fair for the offered amenities including free broadband internet. Location was ok for us. The hotel is located by Thomson and Balestier roads. It's an 8-10 minute walk to the Novena MRT which is just a few minutes from Orchard. We didn't mind walking because we also wanted to know what was nearby. Local food around the hotel is good. A hospital is nearby as well. Traveling by bus was also convenient as the bus stops were near the hotel. As for the room, it may be small for some of our fellow travelers, but it just worked fine for us. It also had a small bathroom, but adequate enough to do your basics. TV also had a few english channels, but we didn't mind because we were out the whole time. The only con that we noticed was the lack of a personal refrigerator. We also checked out the pool and gym. Pool is ok and gym is small with only two machines. But it looks like the gym is well kept and pool is clean. Hotel staff are commendable. Very polite and they try to make your stay as worry-free as possible. We would book here again if we return to Singapore. If you're on a budget and don't want to be in the redlight district, then try this hotel. =)

Reviews.Title: “No Window”
Reviews.Author: seda79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night only. To be fair I have to say that if I would have gotten a room with window, my experience would possibly have been different. However, the room that I booked throgh Agoda.com for over 120.00 Sing dollars did not have a window and was therefore really stuffy and a rather depressing and sad sight. I tried to move over to the window side but all was full. The location is OK, it is easy enough to get a taxi but if you like going around by MRT, the next station "Novena" is quite far. Cable internet connection was provided in the room and worked fine. Would I stay here again? Maybe but only in a room with window and not for that price!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel at a cheap price”
Reviews.Author: BeammeupScotty_75
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Thomson for two nights between the 15th & 17th of April. We took the shuttle from the airport to the hotel, which cost 9 SGD a person and took about 40 minutes. The hotel is situated a little outside the centre of the city, but this isn't a problem as the Novena MRT station is only a 10-15 minute walk away. There are several local cheap Chinese restaurants on the right-hand side as you walk to the MRT. I would recommend trying them. The hotel is new and in good condition - there is a nice swimming pool on the 7th floor. The room was very small - especially with a young child - but it was new and clean. It was fine for our needs as you don't come to Singapore to spend time in your room. The only complaint I had was that the walls are fairly thin - we could hear next-door's television and people talking in the corridor. The staff were helpful and efficient when you asked them anything. The things I like most about the hotel is that it's cheap, clean, has a nice swimming pool and is in a good location for restaurants and the MRT. It would have been nice if there was breakfast included, but this is fairly uncommon for a budget hotel in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “VERY DISAPPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: kutie12345
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights in this hotel. First impression is that the room and toilet are very small. I had no problem with that. Toilet ceiling had some mould growing and even spread to the ceiling room. This was very unexpectable from any hotel. The toilet had no ventilation fan at all, as most hotels do (even budget ones), hence the mould. Most annoying part is that the walls in the room were SOOOO thin!! I can hear people walking, babies crying, other visitors shower, my friend's toilet business and even people pulling/pushing heavy big carts in the middle of the night!! Couldn't get any sleep at all.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant very clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: nic1102
Reviews.Content: I booked this last minute and found the service brilliant. On first appearances I thought I was in the middle of nowhere but actually we were on main bus route, ten min from mrt and had a fabulous choice of cafes and chicken and rice joints on Balestier road. Reception are great really helpful efficient and we ordered taxis from there very helpful. Even had door staff felt really safe and secure. The room was as good as any IBIS i have been too in fact id go as far as to say cleaner, better beds and great black out curtains. The view was great we were on tenth floor. and cleaned everyday without fail. Little noisey on corridor sometimes but it was a busy hotel so to be expected you get that in any hotel i have stayed in ! The pool was fab on 7th floor always enough beds and never too busy. All in all a great budget hotel i recommend if you want to be centrally located without the price tag!!!! would book again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: AngieOW
Reviews.Content: The room, though small, was very clean. The nearest MRT station is Novena, about 10 minutes walk for Singaporean but 20-25 minutes walk for Indonesian like me :) But there is 2 bus stations near the hotel (3 minutes walk), 7Eleven store, and food courts (15 minutes walks) and the cabs are easy to find. The staffs were very friendly and helpful-they provided my room with iron and iron board as I asked this to them by e-mail.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable with good location”
Reviews.Author: aryaits
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel for our four days stay in Singapore mainly based on its good rating on TripAdvisor. Searched many hotels but found this one to be good one in terms of price & location. Price-wise it is on par with other better-class hotels. The owners and staff are social at just the right level and they go to great length to make you feel at home. Food is not available except breakfast but lot many eating places are nearyby. It is a hotel where you would definitely come back to and recommend to your friends. Not very much luxurious but , I’m sure we will still fondly remember the vacation we had there.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for budge traveller”
Reviews.Author: casperkamal
Reviews.Content: Value Thompson is a good budget hotel located at a decent place. I prefer to stay here instead the very cheap hotels that operate near the red light areas. This hotel location is ideal and 750 meters walking distance from the Novena MRT. Hotel facilities were good, the internet costed as 10SGD per day. But i heard from fellow travelers that few rooms don't have a window. But i would still recommend it if you are on a tourist trip and looking only for a place to lie down in the night... They agreed to hold our language for a day which we collected at the end of the day. This way i was able to save an extra day of lodging at the hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Pool, bicycle machine, pay for internet”
Reviews.Author: rmm69
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the first two days of my Singapore trip. The taxi found it no problem from the airport - though we had to specify that it is the Value Hotel Thomson (there are three Value hotels in chain). Hotel was good. The rooms are small - but this is Singapore on a budget - but they are clean. The shower/toilet does get wet when you have a shower, but can live with that. Reception staff were okay. Have to pay for internet ($10 for the day, there is a cable in the room or wireless can work but is not stable and drops out sometimes). Bed was comfy with clean sheets, though I could hear some people in the hall way as they walked and talked past my room. However, I am writing this from another, more expensive hotel and have the same issue. Didn't disturb my sleep though. You pay extra for a room with a window. Caught bus in to Orchard Rd shopping centre as there are not that many things to look at near the hotel. For the price I would recommend this hotel, sure.

Reviews.Title: “I will never go back there ever again.”
Reviews.Author: sam248
Reviews.Content: First impressions were small and clean.. The bathroom looked tiny, there was barely any shower, but it looked decent. Stayed here for 3 nights. My first night, I found hair underneath the doona on the sheets, and I barely got any sleep at all- that bed was full of bed bugs!!! I called the people at the front desk and insisted they clean it up, two of them came up but they said they couldn't do anything until the morning because they didn't have any empty rooms, the cleaners weren't there, they didn't have any sprays... ridiculous. I didn't sleep the whole night. In the morning they said they would clean it, but when I returned the pillows had stains and dried..stains. (just look at the pictures..) I found it incredibly unhygienic, i just had to make sure the whole of my body is completely covered in clothing in bed. Poor service, dirty sheets and stains... needless to say I am never going back there again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “New, Modern, Minimalist”
Reviews.Author: fly1ngf1sh
Reviews.Content: I liked it. I had a small room with a big comfy bed. The design very modern, or rather minimalist & everything was new. The room is furnished just with the bed, a big flat screen TV, tiny table for the tea&coffee maker & a (2 shirts only) wardrobe. The bathroom has been reduced to the absolute necessary: loo, sink, mirror, shower head, no shower tray! You close bathroom door and flood the bathroom floor. Not perfect but no big deal. I liked the massive window which takes up the entire wall. It made the room feel spacious and there is a kind of window seat or step over the whole length of the window. Nice to sit on and enjoy the view and also the spot to put your suitcase. Check-In was quick and efficient, staff friendly. Internet cost 10 SGD per day. Nearest SMRT stop is Novena station a good 10 minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and modern hotel little away from the CC”
Reviews.Author: Jellert
Reviews.Content: The hotel has very modern interiour and the staff at the door as well as at the reception are really friendly and helpfull. Also the elevators move quickly and the pool is really nice, but don`t expect a lot from the gym. He`s smaller than an average bathroom (only 2 machines - one for running and one for cycling). And that`s the same for the room -> we took a deluxe or superior room (don`t know for shure) and he was really really clean with a good bed/matress but the bathroom and room itselves is just a little too small. You don`t pay that much for a stay in this hotel but you have to take every time a cab (cheap) or subway (the most efficient in the world) into the city centre. Not a big deal. The breafast isn`t continental so if you don`t mind you can have it in the hotel. We didn`t try it. This is an honest review. We were happy with our stay in Value Hotel Thomson.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy.”
Reviews.Author: Mmonkie
Reviews.Content: Just finished a 2night stay at the Value Thomson Hotel. It's a nice little budget hotel and is value for the money.
