The check-in and reception can best be described as indifferent but it's a budget hotel. The bellboy we had was a nice friendly guy. We had the superior room located at the end of the corridor (more about this later). The room is small, probably around 19sqm. The bathroom 1.5sqm, toilet, sink, shower squeezed into one little are for 1 person. Basically when you shower, everything gets wet. The room was clean, nice LCD tv but no fridge so no cold drinks. Location is ok. A brisk 10-15min walk to Novena SMRT station and only 2 stops to Orchard or in my case a straight line, 6stops, to Raffles. Also food options are available in the area, if you like Bak kut teh you will be in heaven. Now the downside. The hotel is NOISY. You can hear anyone and everyone in the hallway. The 2 nights I spent I could hear people talking, laughing, shouting , screaming and doors slamming etc. I was in the corner unit at the end of the hallway. I shudder to think if I was located in the middle. I am not exaggerating when I say I was woken up by the noise. Maybe the hotel can dampen the noise by putting in carpeting, wall hangings or plants to absorb some if the noise. In summary, a nice hotel that's value for money but noisy.

Reviews.Title: “You get no more, but you get no less”
Reviews.Author: TravelIsMyPassion70
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel for my family after browsing for a budget hotel that gives fair service and accommodation. The rate is exemptionally low among other Singapore hotels. Reviews are fair. We were not expecting some frills for this hotels. The no-fridge room was expected, and it was not a big deal for us. What was dissapointing is the size of the room. I never expected it to be that small. The single bed is just fitting our 13 yr old girl, so what more for a husband and wife in a single bed. I need not say that there is no room for another mattress on the floor. The toilet and bath is for kids under 10 yrs old, practically no space to move. Anyway, sleep is good after a tiring day. I was looking forward to the S$10/person bfast, yes we tried it, but did not attempt to repeat the experience. Styro plates do not befit a guest of the hotel. A more appropriate ceramic plate is acceptable. The food taste fair, but the buffet table and drinks are not refilled on time. For an experience eating, try at the bfast outside hotel just few block along Ballester road, cheaper and satisfying. Bus rides to Night Safari, Orchard, Merlion Park was an experience, drivers are accomodating. MRT to Universal Studios is easy, walking back and forth Novena station is exactly 15 minutes. Hotel location is isolated but not inaccessible to common places of interest. There's a Cheers convenience store nearby, convenient for buying water. I would recommend this hotel to budget conscious travelers who do not expect so much. Rate is fair enough, you get no more, but no less. (Just expect really small room and toilet and bath).

Reviews.Title: “Small, chic but affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: beachieSG
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a week and had a good experience all throughout. Didn't have high expectations though given its price but was not disappointed at all. Room was small but clean. Bed was comfy and clean linens. Surprised they provided a duvet (other budget hotels I stayed at only offered a thin sheet as blanket). Has hairdryer, coffee/tea making facility, tiny cabinet as closet. No mini bar / personal ref. No free wifi (you can request but is chargeable). Bathroom was small and had no divider between the shower and sink / toilet area. Saw some green mold between the tiles that needed scrubbing. Other than that, it looked okay. Staff were nice. Very accomodating and attentive for a budget hotel. There are several bus stops infront and across the hotel. If you have a bus card, take a 3-min walk to Thomson Rd bus stop and you'll find several buses that'll take you to the nearest mrt station (novena) and to Orchard Rd. By bus, Orchard is only a couple of stops away (10-15 mins). Highly recommended for travelers who are looking for a no-frills hotel. Quite a good price for Singapore price range and it's only a few years old. Price range: $119-139/ night

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: Teuntravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Singapore to attend a fair at the Singapore Expo and used this hotel as a home base for during my stay there. Coming from a hospitality background I know I could not expect 5-star hotel rooms, venues or service coming to this hotel. The hotel has decent prices, the rooms are quite new and fairly clean - very small though, with hardly enough space to put your suitcase down. On top of that the hotel is incredibly noisy, so don't think about sleeping in. The main point of criticism is the service, or more so the lack of service. There seems to be no communication between any of the managers, no body seems to have a clue what is going on and the handling of complaints is just terrible. * It took them 30 minutes to find my reservation - never had any explanation why it took so long. * Taxi's that have been ordered the day before, because I was on a tight schedule regarding meetings were not called or were given away to other guests. * There is no wireless internet - they have a signal but apparently is "hasn't been working for months". You have to use a cable but also that internet is down most of the time. Working from the hotel is thus virtually impossible. * Internet was included in my room, but they have the password change every day which you have to pick up from the counter on a piece of paper. Every single day they tried to charge me $4 for that. In the end I tried working on the public computers in the lobby, once again tried to charge me for it. * There is no directory in any room, so you have to find all the opening closing times, the telephone numbers, the internet policy, the tv channels (BTW no DVD player) etc. out by going to the reception every time. * The gym: two fitness machines of which one was out of order. * Breakfast is absolutely horrible. You have to have breakfast next door in a restaurant which is run by the most rude person I have ever met. He is actually scolding guests for not finding a sauce that is on the table, inside is closed 45 minutes before the buffet ends so you have to sit in the sun outside, the food is almost empty 30 minutes before the buffet closes and the quality of the food is terrifying. * Swimming pool: nice, but quite small and closes at 7 so you can't have a refreshing dive in if you had meetings all day. * On top of this, during my entire stay of 8 days - nobody actually said sorry for anything. Everything was apparently out of their hands and they just ignored any complaint I had. Trying to talk to one of the managers, and asking if they would treat everyone staying at their hotel for 8 days, taking up 3 rooms like this without offering any excuses or not even a simple beer or whatever - the response was: "We don't have beer." In conclusion, the hotel could be great value for money, but the terrible service is not even worth the little money you pay.

Reviews.Title: “could be better”
Reviews.Author: martinlizard
Reviews.Content: nice clean hotel , not well located though if you don't like to walk or spend lots of money on taxis . Room was small , clean , no window . Missed a small refrigerator to cool down my drinks . Swimmingpool on 7th floor was small but nice . I think charging their own hotelguests 4$ /30 min for internet-use is not what to do , it should be for free like in most Hotels/gh's i stayed in .

Reviews.Title: “Ask to look at the room before you pay”
Reviews.Author: vaipatel
Reviews.Content: We were asked at the front desk to make the full payment and then provided with a room that was very tiny and had a view into someone else's home! This effectively meant we'd never be able to open the drapes. After speaking to management, we were provided with a much better room (at a higher price) that we were willing to pay for to get out of the old one. Staff were helpful on the whole, rooms were kept clean and the design of the place is minimalist and comfortable. Excellent for budget travelers, well connected by bus to the city and it's also very easy to find cabs outside the hotel. There's a pool and very small gym in the hotel. Just outside the building is a conveniently located 24 hr corner store and a pretty good chinese restaurant. On the whole, a very pleasant experience after the initial speedbump. I would definitely recommend this place to any budget traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service, dirty practices”
Reviews.Author: enjoyslifetraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is priced low and location consider acceptable. The renovations are new and room seems to be good though very small. However, it is somehow like a "dark" hotel with dirty practices, like cheating management and unhygienic way of cleaning the toilet. On the 3th of March, I booked in the hotel, the feeling was great as everything is so new. However, after I took a bath, the bathroom became FLOODED and I called the operator for someone to remove the water. The room keeper came into the bathroom and used the unused guest towels to clean the toilet, then is really unhygienic to me as these towels will be reused for the guests for bathing. Next, when we cancelled one night after the first night due to the poor trained and managed staffs. The assistant manager claimed himself as the manager and tried his best to not allowing the refund to take place until we warned him that we would complain against him and call police, then he just refunded the amount to us. The policy of hotel is before 12 noon, you are able to cancel the following day for no charges. Luckily we are frequent travelers and if not, we will get CHEATED!! Please think twice before you go to this hotel, there are many other budget hotels around but definitely not such with DIRTY practices and horrible services by the hotel including the management. My advice is never try this hotel for even once!

Reviews.Title: “Good for value!”
Reviews.Author: AsisParajuli
Reviews.Content: Its good for value. Although the bathroom is very tiny overall its very good at its value. It also has fitness and a room top summing pool.

Reviews.Title: “Just about good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: travel_mood
Reviews.Content: Hotel room is small but still acceptable. Bed is good and have a flat TV. Room is clean and tidy. Front desk people is somewhat friendly. Problem comes when group of people checked in night time, surely so noisy. However, don't get drawn with that problems cause housekeeping will ask them to keep it down... Just step out of the hotel is a nice restaurant called "2nd kitchen". Try the seafood especially steam fish... yummy.... next to the restaurant got convenient store "Cheers". If you want to buy local phone number, ask them, they will help doing it. Some hawkers also available nearby. The nearest mrt station is Novena station. Takes about 15min walk. Taxi to orchard is about S$6.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Team of staff”
Reviews.Author: pony66
Reviews.Content: I visited Singapore frequently over the last couple of months, sometimes alone and sometimes with family. We like the location, comfort of bed and pillows, clean rooms and friendly door men. However I found one better reason than the abovementioned. They have excellent crisis controlled team. I had an accidet nearby the hotel early January. Upon getting back to the room, I vomitted badly and became semi concious. I called the front desk asking for help. within 5 minutes, a staff with jacket arrived with few assistants arrived to the room. upon seeing my condition, he asked someone to send for ambulance and at the same time, he instructed the assistants to tag my luggages. He gave the tags to my 12 years old child and provide a calling card where he could be contacted. Also he asked my child for my flight booking info. He would let the airline know of my situation. The paramedic and ambulance arrived within 10 minutes. After I was admitted to the hospital, a friend brought my child back to the hotel to proceed with the check out and collecting the bags. All check out procedures were done and bags were given to my child efficiently. I have had stayed in many hotels over the years, from budget to so called 6 star deluxe hotels all over the world. I had never expect a budget hotel can provide such efficient service and an excellent crisis controlled team. My injury could have been worst if not of the team as internal bleeding of the brain is quite serious. I feel blessed and thankful that I had chosen not only a good hotel but also a hotel with a good team of staff. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “exactly as we need”
Reviews.Author: Tjoa_Susanto
Reviews.Content: -good location, near hawker/resto which open till late night -clean -good price (compare to service/value) -only takes several bus stop to founder bak kut teh, loy kee and wong kee.

Reviews.Title: “Vulue hotel - value for money”
Reviews.Author: claky
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Value Hotel Thompson for 4 nights in January. I arrived at the hotel at 7.00 a.m. and expected to be told that check in was at 2.00 and to come back then but I was checked in immediately. The rooms while not overly spacious was clean and had all the facilities that you would need. The TV was a flat screen and a good size. The tea and coffee was welcome along with the hairdryer. The sheets were of a good thread count and I liked the duvet. The bathroom was small but worked well. The standout for me along with the swimming pool was the staff. They were very helpful, even printing out bus maps. The only negative for me was that the bed was a little on the hard side but that would not stop me from booking this hotel again because the price, location and staff are all standouts.

Reviews.Title: “New, spick and span hotel - but noisy guests”
Reviews.Author: juliezzz
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights mid December and selected the hotel based on amenities and price. Per other reviews, the rooms and esp. bathroom are tiny, but they suited our purposes. Beds comfy. Food and drinks are not allowed around the pool area so you tend not to spend extended time up there. The kids did enjoy it though. I cannot fault the cleanliness, room for the price or service from the excellent staff both on reception and housekeeping. What did marr my stay somewhat were the incredibly inconsiderate guests who would arrive home at 12pm, 1am, 2am, 3am or the folks who would check out at 5am, 6am etc and would essentially laugh, shout or squeal their way down the corridor to the lifts. This is a budget hotel and as such has tiled floors everywhere which does nothing to absorb sound. On one night I walked out of my room 3 times to request school children on excursion or partying teens who were running from room to room to please keep the noise down as it was 3am. I am known as a heavy sleeper but the noise from the hallway was really, really loud. Given that - I still feel pretty positively about the hotel as you essentially get what you pay for. Also, their internet connection is slow and expensive at S$4 per half an hour so we'd just walk across the road to the internet cafe for S$1 per hour with fast speeds. The "barista" in the cafe/noodle shop across the road also does an awesome coffee!

Reviews.Title: “hassle free new year's stay”
Reviews.Author: icep0p
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend decided to book a trip to visit me in Singapore for the New Year. We only had a week to look for a hotel and most of the good ones were either fully-booked or had ridiculously high rates for the holidays. Given that, we decided to book a superior double room at Value Hotel Thomson since they were one of the cheapest in the bunch, and the pictures and reviews were relatively nice. I must say I was very pleased with our 2-night stay there, The rooms were small yes, but everything was clean and new. The room had a nice bay window overlooking condominiums within the neighborhood. The toilet and bath was tidy and the water heater worked well. The bed was big and had immaculate white sheets, The a/c worked fine, you can tell it is still of good working condition. And there was LCD tv too (though I must say the non-local cable channels were limited). Housekeeping was great, you would find new supplies of coffee/tea/mineral water/toiletries after coming back from your city stroll. I only regret not being able to take a dip in the pool, but I went to that area to take pictures and it was really lovely considering that this is just a mid-rise hotel. As for giving constructive criticism, I guess the reception guys can improve on their hospitality, When we checked in they were really nice and chatty and even hailed a cab for us. But after that I think I never heard a single "good morning" or "hello" albeit the number of times I walked through their doors. Just a bit more warmth won't hurt. :) And oh, it would be fantastic if they can offer free wifi. To sum it all up, I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a reasonably priced comfortable, clean hotel. This is value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: LisaandKarl
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money. We stayed here 3 nights between christmas and NY and it was a great hotel for us. Clean, cheap and modern. The rooms are very small, in fact they are not overally small you just don't get anything other than the bed a toliet room with doubles up to your shower The only downside the walls are paper thin so you can here noise The swimming pool is good and the gym is a very small space with 1 runner and 1 bike The staff were friendly and helpful but no wifi there is internet in the room but you do have to pay for it If you are backpacking or travellers its really good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Small but good for a day”
Reviews.Author: Raymondkl
Reviews.Content: Thomson values is really a hotel which i am going to stay again if i go singapore., As it was strategy locate for almost everything when i driving to singapore recently. 7-Elevent , Chinese food , taxi , 5 free car park , Small and clean room (infact not really small i believe there still got space if wanted to sleep 1 more people). Bath room as mention by other is small but it adaquate for me to bath my baby together..:) There also a tinny swimming pool + gym for workout , when we swim over there yesterday i saw those worker is daily checking the water to make sure it clean and safe also...1 thumb up..:)

Reviews.Title: “Small, tidy, and efficient”
Reviews.Author: AshLily3888
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had a pleasant stay, although we did not spend much time in the room. The room itself was tiny, with no window. There was a flat screen tv, in the rooom. The bathroom was clean and very efficient. The shower was hot, but not separated from the toilet or rest of the bathroom. There was a tiny swimming pool on the roof, which was nice to relax in and swim after a long day. There is no wifi, and you have to pay for internet access via two computers in the lobby. Breakfast was not included. On the plus side, the location, while not entirely central is fairly close (less than 10 min walk) to the train station if you are using public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Small... but decent, clean and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Wilibona
Reviews.Content: This hotel has one of the smallest room that I have ever been to, but looking at the price that I paid, I think it is definitely worth it. It is clean (must have for me), located in acceptable and decent area, not noisy, close to the bus stop (about 10 min walk to MRT). The bathroom and the bedroom is on the small side (11 sq mtr), but definitely worth it if you are travelling on budget. Just consider twice if you are planning to have more than 2 person in the room (even with kids), or if you have plenty of luggage to bring. You may not have enough space to store them.

Reviews.Title: “Good for solo and adventurous travelers”
Reviews.Author: Richpip25
Reviews.Content: I came to Singapore to run the half marathon and I only stayed for a few days. Naturally I wanted a budget hotel with basic amenities and hence I chose this place mainly because of the free internet (cable, not wireless). Getting to the hotel: I used MRT from Changi International Airport to Dhoby Ghaut then changed train to reach Novena station. The whole trip costs less than S$2 and it's cost effective for those who don't have heavy luggages. Upon reaching the station, you can walk to the hotel which takes about 15-20 minutes depending on your pace. The hotel is easily spotted from the main road. Check-in service: The receptionist was courteous and professional. I arrived earlier than expected (around 12.30pm) and I was told that they needed to clean the room first so I left my luggage and went out to explore the nearby shopping mall (Velocity and Novena Square). Room: The room is somewhat small with two single beds. I opted for the no window room to save an extra S$10 per day. The room looks clean and new. The beds are comfortable with clean sheets and I didn't experience any bedbug bites throughout my stay. A wall mounted LCD TV is available with over 10 channels and directly below the TV is a mini cabinet to hang your clothes (with irremovable hangers). A mini table is situated next to the TV and complimentary 2 bottles of water are given every day. There is also an electric kettle with cups and complimentary instant tea and coffee sachets and a hair dryer placed inside the drawer. A telephone is also available if you need to make a call. The walls are unfortunately thin and you can always hear people talking outside the room. Thankfully my room was at the end of the hallway so it wasn't too bad. Toilet/shower room: All in one room. Very small and not suitable for large people. Once you start showering, everything will be wet. Complimentary shower gel, shampoo, toothbrush and toothpaste are given. Toilet papers are also available. Towels are provided and changed daily. Summary: For S$119 per night, this hotel is not too bad. I would have chosen a cheaper hotel but I wasn't too sure about the cleanliness. I didn't use the gym or the swimming pool so I can't comment on that. Check-out time is at 12pm and you'll get an automated call to remind you of this. There are many local eateries near the hotel but if you prefer Western cuisines, you are better off going to the city. Convenience stores are also within the vicinity. If you need a taxi, you can always ask the staff for assistance otherwise try your luck flagging one at the roadside.

Reviews.Title: “Quite ok and acceptable”
Reviews.Author: cookies_secret
Reviews.Content: 1. It is somewhat inconvenient to those who wanna take the MRT service. Perhaps ones should take a bus and have a 5-10mins. journey to get to the nearest MRT station(Novena) at the Novena Square. 2. Reasonable, i spent about SGD90 for a room per night. 3. Hmm, a little bit too small and the toilet gets wet easily when bathing, anyway, it's still ok. My room has a huge window, it brought me a bit surprise as i thought it doesn't have a window like other rooms as others said. M quite satisfied with the room during my stay there as it is located at the end of corridor, that's why quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Young Adults”
Reviews.Author: eggtartyum
Reviews.Content: for young adults who doesn't mind living in a not-so-luxurious hotel this hotel is recommended for you i booked a triple room for 5 days everyday our room is so messy and the hotel cleans it nicely and they are also decent because one of my friend forgot to lock her luggage and the guy who cleans our room left it as it was the location is also quite good it is accessible from novena mrt or you can take bus (however it is recommended to go by bus to the mrt station) (about 10 mins walk) there is also a good restaurant named '2nd kitchen' it was also nice you guys should try the seafood it is interesting However, if you want to stay in this hotel you should consider some points such as the gym described is not really a gym, it was just 3/4 sports equipment that people would normally have in their house it is quite noisy,especially in the morning and when you are about to sleep because people are talking in the corridor and it was quite noisy but generally, this hotel provides a good service :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: bingir
Reviews.Content: The most worthy part was the swimming pool. For the price the hotel was charging, I was real glad for the pool. Other amenities too were up to our expectations. We had a comfortable stay. Food is available at additional cost, not included in room rent. We never ate there so can't comment on the food. Staff was courteous. Internet is available at $10 a day. Local calls at $1 a day plus call charges apply. Thoroughly satisfying experience.

Reviews.Title: “With us, it is a good hotel for budget”
Reviews.Author: 7nugentdave4
Reviews.Content: Heard and read a lot about this small island – nation that why we stopped here as a first destination following our SEA tour after EURO tour. It was a good time so far for us. We were quite pleased with the hotel deal. It’s flexible with our budget for a long trip. Room was a bit more but it did not matter us because it was warm and comfortable. It is small hotel (to compare with the hotel size in Singapore) but it still can fulfill all of your need – Gym – restaurant – Swimming pool. With us, it is a good hotel for budget.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: aznpridegirl217
Reviews.Content: Room - small, cosy and clean. Bathroom - really very very small. if someone is showering, you can't use the toilet, and vice-versa Noise - walls are paper-thin! we could hear ALL sorts of noise at night... not recommanded for light-sleepers! Location - close to Novena MRT station, but on a hot afternoon, it's better to bus (about 3 stops) to the MRT station Staff - you have to let the phone ring a while before someone at reception picks up, but they are very friendly and helpful. we asked for extra blanket and pillow cases and they were promptly delivered by housekeeping :) Internet - S$10/day. When I booked the rooms online, the fee was waived, but you need to confirm this upon check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: sweet_mermaid
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the superior twin room, booked from the hotel website, at SGD$119/nite/nett. Room : Windows, very tight space, 2 small single beds, small bathroom. Location : Away from sleazy stuff in the balestier area, at junction of Thomson medical centre and balestier road. Walking distance to the bus stop, which is about 10 mins bus ride to Orchard. Far from Novena MRT. Taxi ride is only about $5-7 to Orchard. It's about 20-30mins to the airport (depends on the traffic jam) on PIE expressway. Food : There's a quite popular chinese restaurant downstair, quite packed during dinner time. Didn't try it nor their $10 breakfast. Balestier itself is famous for its affordable old eateries including Pork Ribs Soup, so there's a good variety of cheap eats near the hotel. Check in was seamless, didn't expect any service but staff were polite. Not suitable for family as the room is just too small, but for the price, it's a good deal for most travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money; would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: katwmn6
Reviews.Content: Don't know what everyone is moaning about - best budget hotel I've ever stayed in. Only recently built; helpful front desk staff; affordable in-room internet (S$10/day); everything is clean; it's a 10-15 min walk tops to the Novena MRT station; hawers' food market right next door w/lots of good restaurants on Balestier road; 30 min walk or 5 min cab ride to Little India; nice swimming pool; cable TV; complimentary bottled water; etc. Yes, there is a wet room for the bathroom - this is fairly standard for budget hotels in Asia. Yes, the gym is very small (2 machines) - but it's a clean, cheap hotel that has doormen, a pool and some workout equipment! Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and cheap,but you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: stealth007
Reviews.Content: While the staff were pleasent, and the room modern and tidy, that's all this hotel has to offer. The rooms are very small. There is no bar fridge or safe in the room. The toilet and shower are one in the same. That is when you shower the toilet and entire small bathroom gets wet. Breakfast was not included except, they said it's only $10.00 each at the adjoining restaurant. However if your not a local there is nothing that will satisfiy your taste. With rooms being so small you could hear all the going on's of people throughout the day and night, sleep was poor. Ending on a good note the pool was quite nice. If it's for 1 night all o.k

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cheap but small and noisy.”
Reviews.Author: Laksalover
Reviews.Content: The Value Hotel Thomson is a little out of the way, so the price is good. It's a ten to 20 minute walk to the nearest MRT station. I stayed in two different rooms - the first a value room and the second a deluxe room. The value room was on a lower floor and at night the adjacent rooms were extremely noisy with large groups of kids and young adults running up and down the hallways and often shouting and screaming till very late (till 3 am a couple of times). But the deluxe room was on an upper floor and peaceful. The value rooms are extremely small, no wardrobe, no drawers etc. The hotel is clean and the staff perfunctory, some were happy to help, others annoyed to be asked to do something. The hotel is close to the Burmese buddhist temple and the Sun-Yet-Sen museum. There are a couple of food courts very close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Adventorus Holiday”
Reviews.Author: mohdmuhizam
Reviews.Content: Small room for a pax with a 5 year old boy. If you plan to spend most of the time outside the hotel, with the price,cleanliness of the room, good air condition, re-furbish room,distance to the public transport station - it's a recommended hotel. A healthy 5 minutes walking distance to the nearest bus stop which can take you to Novena MRT station.With a proper travelling planning, you can board at the same bus stop & goes direct to Orchard road, Sungei Road, Bugis street, etc...Muslim foods is a bit hard to find.There's 2 muslim stalls behind the bus stop heading towards Novena which we only discover it on our last day..With the efficient public transport system, you just need to be a bit creative & do a lot of map reading....

Reviews.Title: “Economical hotel with pool”
Reviews.Author: johnsbint
Reviews.Content: Covered drive thru' entrance with chaps opening the front door in daytime. Spacious air conditioned marble lobby with 4 check in desks. A seating area + internet terminals. Friendly efficient check in. Our room was small with a wall of window. There are bigger rooms for more money but we were only staying for a couple of days so we took the cheapest. There are wall hangers and a very deep window sill/storage area. Bed very comfortable, linen clean and crisp. Can walk round the bed but no bedside table/shelf or bedside lights. There is a hairdryer and an internet access plug in thing which you pay for at reception. En-suite is a wetroom. White and clean with basic toiletries however our floor didn't drain properly and we had to step over a puddle by the door. Pressure was good though. Pool on the 7th floor was lovely. Not busy when I was there and very welcome after sightseeing. There's also a small gym room. The hotel is a wee bit outside the city but there are so many buses just outside the hotel and you can buy travel cards very cheaply and you meet some fascinating people on the bus! We liked this hotel very much and would stay there again. There's a great restaurant a few doors down by the bus stop - the 'Hong Kong'. Great food and they speak English.

Reviews.Title: “Ghost!”
Reviews.Author: lyekellyn
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure it's a former hospital saw the girl next door screaming for ghost and cried and she left the hotel immediately with her boyfriend, better check before you book, anyhow it's a clean and unique room with DVD player, hair dryer and drinking service etc., small room and bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Value in expensive Singapore”
Reviews.Author: justyle
Reviews.Content: We heard the hotel had a good location, and clean rooms which it did (5 min walk to Novena MRT). It was centrally located and easy to get around, the rooms were small and basic, but great compared to similarly priced hostels and b&b's in Singapore. The pool is a bonus, although it would of been better to use after the 7 p.m curfew, as its often to hot by 11 a.m to sit out there for too long, and after a days excursion it would be very appreciated. There are a lot of rooms crammed in, and so you may hear guests leaving or arriving in the mornings, but compared to other places in Asia it was no big deal. I would recommend this hotel for a short stay, for those who don't want to pay Singapore prices for luxury. I also found the extortionate charges for internet ironic for a hotel called value.

Reviews.Title: “Low value, even for price”
Reviews.Author: Suz_Q_123
Reviews.Content: As context, we happily stayed at a $37/night holiday inn express in beijing. This hotel is NOT CLOSE to the quality there. Note: we upgraded to a room with a window. We paid the penalty to check out early & get another hotel. Pros - Safe - Clean - Nice pool - Good location, if you don't mind walking to the MRT (10 min) Cons - POOR ROOM QUALITY (no bathroom soap to wash your hands, no hand towel, no in-room safe -- so no where to leave your passports, laptop, money when sightseeing unless you want to leave them at the front desk, no chair, very very small mirror space to get ready in the morning) - SERVICE (had to call for them to make up the room at 4:30pm, were told "you know there are over 600 rooms here, it takes us a while to get to them all") - THIN WALLS (hard to sleep, sound reverberates through the halls. you can LITERALLY hear people next door click on and off their light switch) - HORRIBLE INTERNET POLICY (fee is from 12pm one day to the next day, so if you want to use the internet at 9am, you have to pay for a full day -- $10 -- for using it only three hours. also, no wireless, which means tripping over the cord again & again -- see above, since there's no chair...) All of this on top of the small room made for unnecessary shortness and loss of patience during our travels -- totally not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Pool closes at 7pm”
Reviews.Author: mothrah
Reviews.Content: No need to cringe when you say you went to the Value Hotel Thomson as it is quite respectable. I checked in at 7am and it was no problem. The room was small but sufficient for one person; for two people and a dog it would be tight. The balcony pool is a great feature of this hotel, but the pool closes at 7pm which is way too early. Catching buses from Balestier Road is a bit random, so my advice is to walk to the train station. Where is it? Go to the pool area and look straight ahead at the building with the circle symbol on it. That is about where the Novena train station is: about seven minutes walk. Once there you will have no problem getting to the touristy spots.

Reviews.Title: “there is value for money”
Reviews.Author: sprasheed
Reviews.Content: we booked the hotel through online. we selected the hoted especially by reading the review of many visitors. after reaching there we feel the review was all correct. so we paid our payment at counter. no need of credit card payment. acomedation, cleaness and services fine. they arranged siteseen trip and all with comfort

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, good location! Great value.”
Reviews.Author: Geo_Denmark
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, but it has small rooms. A real nice chose for a vacation in Singapore. But why does the pool close so soon, then it is a city hotel and everybody is out seeing the town all day and comes back to the hotel at night! The breakfast is no good!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, OK location”
Reviews.Author: TravelinMan50
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night. The reviews are very accurate. The hotel isn't perfect, but is a great choice. I also spent some time at the hotel Aqueen Lavendar later on the same trip and the two are very comparable. I preferred the Aqueen for the extra money because the room layout is a little better- especially the bathroom, and you get a breakfast. The staff is professional and efficient, but not really warm or friendly. Having said that, if you stay here, go across the street, the big street and check out the little restraurants for breakfast! If you're looking for something sweet and unique. cross the busy street and see what they offer over there!

Reviews.Title: “Decent value and location”
Reviews.Author: andh_19
Reviews.Content: Arrived 12:30 and checked in early with no problems to stay 10 days mid-July. Booked superior rooms (slightly more than standard with a nice big window) for $123 SD/night. Room was on the 11th floor overlooking the pool. Hotel provided 2 bottles of water, tea, coffee, kettle, hair dryer and flatscreen TV with a couple channels. You can get broadband internet for $10/day, but there's an internet cafe across the street for $1 SG/hour or walk 10 minutes to Novena and there's a free kiosk at the information stand down the hall you can use for ½ hour. You can take various buses including Bus 131 to Novena to catch the MRT. Shower is open and the whole bathroom gets wet when showering so there's not really a place to put your clothes or toiletries. It's rather difficult to get dressed after a shower as there's not a dry spot on the floor. That might be a deal breaker for some. Also, housekeeping just rinsed out our mugs daily (still had coffee rings on the inside) so we always made sure to wash them ourselves. You can buy the buffet breakfast for $10 SG (we had it for $7 for early booking but had to remind front staff and show the confirmation email) for the 2nd Kitchen Restaurant across the parking lot. We only ate there twice as there's lots of hawker stands around the area for meals $3 or $4 SG. There;s a Burger King and KFC at Novena if you're looking for a breakfast twister or waffle for around $5 SG. It unfortunately does NOT have a clock radio/alarm, in-room safe, mini-fridge, chairs or a table. Noticed the halls are a bit noisy but not really any worse than others we've stayed at. If you're making any locals calls, you pay $1 SG /day. The pool on the 7th floor was quite pleasant, although probably quite noisy if you have a room on that floor. Rooms are definitely small, but the air conditioning works well and the rooms are basically clean. Flip-flops and pool towels are good to bring. There's two 7-Elevens within walking distance. Overall a good stay as long as you can deal with an open shower.

Reviews.Title: “Gem”
Reviews.Author: KennyClarkson
Reviews.Content: Highest rated cheap hotel in Singapore. This was superb great location, bus stops outside, subway station 5 mins walk. Rooms are tiny, but it is just somewhere to sleep, everything you need at a great price. Resturaunt outside is also very good.

Reviews.Title: “FAB! Very helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Wardy86
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just for a stop over really, but if we ever go back to Singapore we would definatley stay here!! The rooms are small, but comfy, clean and have everything you need! The reception staff are very helpful...they helped us with all directions and transport! There was also always someone to open the door for you!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and value for money but rooms are not sound proof”
Reviews.Author: HappySmileyTraveler
Reviews.Content: As hotels in Singapore is pretty pricey, i must say this one is really worth your money. Although the rooms are very small due to space constraint in Singapore, but it is very clean, tidy and the bed is comfortable. The location is also good, about 10mins walk to novena mrt station and there are many buses that can take you to orchard. Breakfast are not included but you can pay SGD10/person for it. The reception told us we can have a look at the breakfast before deciding to have it. However, we did not have a chance as we woke up late everytime. The room comes with complimentary bottled drinking water and basic toiletries like shampoo, shower gel, toothbrush and shower cap. We did not have much encounter with the staffs so not sure about their service. The only negative thing is the thin wall/door of the room which is practically not sound proof. When your neighbours come back and open their doors, it is as if someone is going to open your door. I got scared a few times during my first night but got used to it after that. the housekeeping staffs can start their work pretty early about 8am and they can be heard clearly and disturbed our sleep. Besides that, our room has poo smell when we check in and also the next day after housekeeping. We were wondering if the housekeeping staff has used the bathroom or the bathroom has bad air ventilation. However, the smell went away after awhile when we kept the door open so it was not a big issue. Overall, this hotel is really value for money considering they really maintain the cleanliness of the rooms which is very important for a hotel. I would definitely recommend this to a budget traveler who is looking for a decent, clean and comfortable room in a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Tiniest room & NO WINDOWS!!!”
Reviews.Author: meenasan
Reviews.Content: Ridiculously small. I understand this hotel is most likely for businessmen or something, because it reminds me of capsule hotels in Tokyo. The rooms are impossible to walk around in, so small that you trip over everything constantly, especially your luggage (as there is NO place for luggage). The bathroom is a closet, you shower where you pee. A common thing in apartments in Asian countries, especially in India where I am from....but in a hotel?! They don't advertise any of that. My boyfriend and I were doing a three week budget trip of Asia. Beijing, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Phuket, and last was Singapore. Of ALL the budget hotels we stayed in, this one was the worst! The hotel staff are not friendly at all either, which doesn't help anything. Also, did I mention like 50% of the rooms in the hotel have NO WINDOWS?! You're like a rat in a cage, you have no concept of time and it's a horrible horrible horrible to attempt sleeping in. Also the doors and walls are paper-thin, I can hear children running up and down the hallways upstairs, heck...I can even hear my neighbor coughing in the room next to me. Next time they should WARN YOU that their rooms have no windows. What an awful experience. Oh, and they're like a 20 minute walk from t he closest metro station, which is entirely too far in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: leogp
Reviews.Content: It's located in the Central area of Singapore. The nearest MRT station is Novena but there are bus stops in front and across the street that can take you anywhere. The rooms are small, but can fit two adults. Our room is in the 7th floor where also the pool is located. Try to avoid getting a room on that floor because its noisy specially in the morning where other guest go the pool. What I don't like is the comfort room which is very small and there's a smell coming from it even we haven't used it. Customer service is standard, I think the staff needs more training in customer service. The room service did not replace the floor mat/rag even its wet. They just replace the towels. No free in room safe, no free internet, and they even charged us $1sgd for making a local call. If you want an above average budget hotel, try the Value Hotel Thomson.

Reviews.Title: “Allows to save money but to be not far from everything!!!”
Reviews.Author: Liana25
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with a small but very clean, new, modern and comfortable room. To compare the price and quality - it is one of the best in Singapore. The receptionists were really attentive and helpful. We arrived about 8 in the morning, after 10 hours flight, and the hotel gave as a room immediately, so we did not have to wait for check-in at 14.00. Thank you! Besides the swimming pool is charming! It is 5-7 minute walk from MRT. It is 2-3 station from the very center. The only minus is no WI-FI. They just have broadband Internet for money.

Reviews.Title: “fair value but mouldy”
Reviews.Author: laings
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night in June 2010. Fair price for singapore. Our room had a window was clean but cramped. My son's room was a similar size with a queen bed but had no window and smelt musty. There was also mould growing on the wall of the bedroom. front desk service was good and quick. The site of the hotel is convenient for the zoo and airport.

Reviews.Title: “very Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonasasgo
Reviews.Content: Time to stay in Balestier Road. this place is one we'll recommend for budget travellers. It has clean room, very near to Novena MRT station, Some small restaurant's outside. This place is a value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money especially if you are on a budget”
Reviews.Author: travelwise2010
Reviews.Content: The hotel was bigger than most budget hotels in the area and it was very presentable. The lobby was small. The front desk staff were brisk and fast in doing their job. There was very little time spent on cordial conversations which suits me fine although some tourist may find it impolite. There were no bell boys so you would have to carry your own luggage to your room. The hotel staffs we saw around the hotel need to be taught basic pleasantries though. None of they bothered to greet us with a simple hello or good morning during our 5 days stay there. We stayed in deluxe rooms and a triple room which both had windows in it. The deluxe rooms had windows overlooking the pool area. The toilet and bath was larger than for the superior room but there was no division between the wet and dry area. Rooms were smaller than luxury hotels but acceptable. The hotel is located far from tourist destination but if you do not mind riding the bus/mrt like the locals then you will not have any trouble with this hotel. The bus stop is just a block or two away and is really quite fun to ride. What you should do once at the airport is get a singapore tourist pass which cost S$8 per day so you can ride buses and mrt for free. It is really worth it. We did not have breakfast in the hotel so I can't say anything about the food. The hotel was fully booked when we were there and they did not have enough room to offer breakfast to everyone. That wasn't a problem since there were this hawker's place just accross the street and a lot more further on where you can get meals for $2-5. The only thing I do not like in this hotel is the noise. Lucky for us our rooms were at the ends of the corridor but even then there was this one time when we woke up at 1am thinking someone was trying to get into our room with the key only to realize they were opening the door next to ours. There was no sound proofing at all. I will be going back to Singapore and would be staying in this hotel again since the price is reasonable and the pros far outweigh the cons

Reviews.Title: “New hotels .”
Reviews.Author: madoron77
Reviews.Content: Quite wide for a small room very very clean with white colors. The hot shower work The room was small but very very neat, clean cool. I really really love the bathroomed out fine and have a strong water. The room always tidy evrytime we came back. The aircon was great. No noisy stuff, no bad smell.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible stay, a brothel disguised as a hotel”
Reviews.Author: FoodEnthused
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed for two nights, and our second night was a nightmare. From 1am onwards, what sounded like a prostitute was accepting men to her room on our floor, and there were all sorts of unpleasant screaming throughout the night until 5am. We hardly got any sleep that night. As other travellers have commented - the reception service was barely acceptable, the room was indeed small but clean, the walls were very thin, and the bathroom was very small and gets completely wet after a shower. A horrible experience, and we will never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, basic and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ayan_Das
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Value Hotel Thompson for 4 days when we visited Singapore. I checked out the internet and it was the cheapest and the best hotel that I managed to get in Singapore away from the red light area. Rooms are very small, but had most of the basic amenties. Overall a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: DundeeTravellers_10
Reviews.Content: Very pleasantly surprised by the hotel. Well located and presented, useful information from the reception desk and relatively cheap to boot! You're not going to find huge rooms or tons of wardrobe space for this price but if, like us, you're more interested in exploring the city that staying in and watching the TV (almost as big as the bathroom!) give this place a try.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, cheap, but far from subway”
Reviews.Author: shanelovesryan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last March 6-9, 2010. It was booked by my cousin who resides in SG at a very cheap price, less than 10,000 Philippine Pesos for two persons for 4 days and 3 nights. The room is small but very clean and has great air conditioning which I needed because I found it very hot in SG. Small bathroom but will suffice if you are not too picky. Nice pool and seems very clean although I didn't swim because I didn't bring a swimsuit. Will definitely come back here but I find the long walk to the subway very inconvenient taking 15-20 minutes of my time (one way). I will recommend this hotel for those on a tight budget and won't mind walking from/to hotel and subway.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the stay”
Reviews.Author: lov
Reviews.Content: Pro: Very clean and stylish / Nice bed / Amenity-hairdryer, bottle water, coffee-tea powder , electric kettle / Location is ok. You can use buses, not too difficult . (you need exact change though) MRT is 10 min. walk / Good price among the Singapore hotel rates. Con: No free wifi - went to the computer place across the st. / For some people, the room might be small. /Toilet-shower in the same room, just need some adjustment...

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations of a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mansi07
Reviews.Content: We were a bit skeptical of booking into this hotel due to reviews wrt the size of the room and the disturbance factor thin walls.....So we made the reseravtions only after reaching there and checking out the rooms....We checked into the superior room as it is bigger, has windows that look out on the road & which was away from the elevators....so it was not very noisy...we slept well.....at SGD89 it met all our expectations and beyond...also it is 7 min walk to Novena MRT..There is a BUS stop & 7 Eleven right opposite the hotel....So connectivitywise it was gr8....

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Cleanliness for Less”
Reviews.Author: magnetic_rose
Reviews.Content: My flatmate and I stayed here instead of imposing on friends for an out of town convention. Although you can have other hotel rooms for less, we thought that the rooms we booked at Value Hotel Thomson was worth what we paid for them. For starters, the hotel room is clean and comfortable -- the room is cleaned everyday, and the linen, towels, and toiletries replaced. The hotel is easily accessed by both bus and train -- and the walk to and from the station introduces you to several restaurants that pack in the local crowds (and that's always a good indication of a restaurant's reputation). The hotel is also located in a residential district, so if you're the sort of person who values a good night's rest this may be your idea of a good hotel. We only had two slight complaints: 1) there was no fridge in the room -- and given how hot it can get in Singapore cold drinks are a must so I hope the management takes this into consideration; and 2) the shower stall is nonexistent, so the water gets everywhere -- you have to wait for a couple of minutes for the floor to dry out before you can use the bathroom again (good thing we bought flip flops!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2009
Reviews.Content: I travel adventure style, but as years go by, I more and more appreciate comfort. Travelling for business or on my own budget, I always look for a good deal. That being said I have looked long and hard for an affordable and comfortable hotel in Singapore. If you are reading this review, you likely know that Singapore is a destination on the relatively expensive side. I have chosen Value Thomson based on the ratings given on tripadvisor.com and have been very happy with the choice. Just to clarify that there are many Value hotels in Singapore, this review refers only to Value Thomson hotel! As mentioned in other reviews the room is small. On the other hand if you travel carry on only, like I do, or with a reasonable size luggage, the room is very well configured and just about the right size. You have what you need for a short term stay, very clean room and bathroom, free coffee and water, good temperature controls. The hotel is not located right beside a subway line, but it is located very close to one, three bus stops away to be more specific. By many standards, these three bus stations are really walking distance, about 5 minutes walk. I have used both taxis and public transit extensively while staying at Value Thomson. The hotel is located conveniently for both, and while taxis in Singapore are affordable, I really feel that using public transit in Singapore is a very good choice. I only wish, I was not so jet lagged and able to use it more. As already mentioned, the rooms and the entire facility for that matter are very clean. Staff, is efficient and very helpful. Based on some other reviews I was somewhat reluctant choosing this hotel as some reviews pointed out the fact the staff, is not exactly helpful. My experience did not confirm that, they were just about perfect. Reception desk was always well staffed, they helped me with suggestions ranging from directions for a first time visitor to Singapore to general advice on food choices or general advice on how to reach a destination. Also worth mentioning is the fact that I had a very late arrival, 6AM. Although the hotel will try to provide a room for early ( very late) arrivals, if available, I did not want to take any chances after 38 hours of travel, so I specifically booked a room early and made sure is available. I have also requested, high floor away from elevators, like I normally do for any hotels, no matter how cheap or expensive. Based on hotel design, all rooms are away from elevators. They delivered spot on the high floor, insulating me from any street noises. Comparing them with any other hotels, I would rate Value Thomson 10/10 for service. The hotel has a pool on the 7th floor, very clean, and pretty much a must after a long day of running around in the hot and humid Singapore. Some reviewers pointed out that some rooms on the 7th floor are noisy. I agree and because of traffic you are better of avoiding them, but only if they are on the way to the pool! The hotel configuration means that only about 3 or 4 rooms are actually in the high traffic area leading to the pool. The hotel has 100+ rooms overall! The one area to be concerned about is noise from other rooms. That could be a problem, but not because of thin walls as is usually the case while travelling in Asia. In this hotel, all floors are ceramic. While it is easy to keep the floors clean, it really makes it for an overall noisier hotel. The noise comes from the hallways, nevertheless if noise is a concern for you, you may want to bring ear plugs. While I would not recommend it, because of room size, there are families with children staying in this hotel; they were the noisiest of all travelers, while trying to get in and out of their rooms. Internet is available, wired and wifi, but at 10$ per day you are better off to go across the street at an internet cafe. Last but not least, I would like to bring out the very important subject of food. Under no circumstances should a traveler be concerned about food in Singapore. Out of all the places I have ever traveled to, Singapore is by far the best place to eat, period. Hawker centers are definitely the way to go at any time of the day. As far as eating, while staying at Value Thomson, I would recommend you cross the street and eat at one of the several eateries around. There are no bad choices really. The hotel restaurant is also good, is just that it is more expensive (20USD vs. 4USD) Overall Value Thomson is a very good choice especially if you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: PTCC
Reviews.Content: Well, it is a budget hotel. It's new and everything seems new. Thus, it is clean and provides a comfortable stay for a couple but not those with kids. The room is very small and there is no space to walk around. The bathroom is awesomely small and you bathe / wash your fash / brush your teeth in all in small compartment next to the wc. There is a flat screen tv and toothbrushes provided. Walking corridors are narrow and you could hear people moving along the corridors as it is not really sound-proof. Accross the hotel, there is a local coffee shop with local delights if you do not wish to eat in the hotel for breakfast of lunch. There is noodles and chicken rice fo you to choose. Walk further up, there is a 7-11 However, for that price you pay, that's what you get for.

Reviews.Title: “Good New Budget Option, w/ important booking tips”
Reviews.Author: uncle-eric
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a reasonably priced hotel at the last minute and found the Thomson Value which is owned by the Hotel 81 group (they have about 40 budget properties around Singapore which are generally known as "Love Hotels" for people on a romantic escapade or folks on a rock bottom budget, simple a clean room with nothing else). After checking reviews I was skeptical but I needed Free WiFi and a pool which is a hard order to fill in Singapore without spending 150 US up. Was also interested to see what the 81 group is doing as they move forward by upscaling a little bit. As I've lived in Thailand for 20 years, own a resort and a couple guesthouses there too, and visited Singapore at least 25 times in that period, I've seen a few places around Sing. Most of my old favorites have been remodeled and are now out of the budget range at 200 US up which I refuse to pay, that's why I had to build Pacific Club Resort in Phuket so me and my friends would have a nice place to stay there at reasonable prices, might have to do the same in Singapore soon:-). We stayed 4 nights and I tried 2 room styles and inspected them all (see booking tip below). Will be visiting Siloso Resort at Sentosa next and let you know how that turns out. Pros * Free Wifi, had problem in one room and they switched rooms for us immediately. * Pool is OK, water quality was great, apparently ozone and salt water purification, no chlorine smell and crystal clear. Nice deck and good sized especially for a budget hotel. Forget the treadmills and bike in the gym, you'll get plenty of exercise while touring Singapore unless you take cabs everywhere. * 7-11 and food courts within walking distance * New property, everything works * Good LCD TV and channels work although the TV seems to be slightly misplaced off to the side of the bed center line. * Fits the budget without staying in a so called "love hotel" or old flea bag place which would be the next step down budgetwise. * Didn't have any problem with "thin walls" mentioned in some other reviews, during the day you can hear people moving around if they pass your room, but not much and it's not any big deal * Staff were fine, some better than others, but if you worked the front desk with 4-5 other people in a 360 room hotel, you might have a few rough days too :-) It's not like anyone is sitting on their butts and most of the time they were great. Housekeeping friendly although they're all imported and don't speak English. Con's * A bit far from everything, but generally in Singapore you're going to spend money on cabs, MRT, etc. Usually after a long day it's hard to keep up the saving since you'll be beat so I end up taking a cab home no matter where I stay, so it's simply a matter of telling the driver where you want to go. Going out in the morning, take any bus at the stop just around the corner from the hotel and you can get to Orchard or several MRT stations within minutes for 1 Sing buck, no big deal. Coming back by taxi from downtown cost about 5 Sing Dollars, not much more than an MRT ride for two. * Breakfast is pretty basic and most people will be disappointed with it unless coffee, rice, baked beans, and eggs fried with tomato sauce on untoasted bread is your main thing (did find a toaster on the second to last day :-). But it's cheap (about 6 Sing Dollars) and it's optional on most booking sites. If you want a proper breakfast, don't take it and use the food courts or do special things with all the money you saved by staying here, like visiting some of the killer buffets in the 5 star hotels or B-Fast at the Singapore Zoo, great start to a really good place to go for a day. * Also dinner at the restaurant seemed a bit higher priced than options within a few minutes walk. It was always full, but we didn't try on account of the price. IMPORTANT BOOKING TIP They have four room types, the folks with the worst comments obviously didn't know this and thought by booking a superior room they were getting the best. Price range I found was from 85 Sing$ (cheapest standard room) to 130 Sing$ (triple room) * Dont' take the standard or superior rooms unless you don't mind a really small bathroom in a tiny room (and in the case of the standard room, no window), just pay the small extra and get a Deluxe (really fine for couples) or Triple for the extra space and nicer bathroom with plenty of space it's well worth it. You'll have to hunt around or contact the hotel directly as most 3rd party sites only offer the cheaper room types. BTW, triple room is OK for family with one kid. Hope this review helps singles or couples who are trying to do Singapore on less than 125 US/day for room, food, Wifi, and basic transportation (no drinking or smoking:-). Uncle Eric

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: Sousa9
Reviews.Content: My partner and I planned to stay here for 2 nights as a stopover before flying to our next destination. We ended up staying 4 due to our flight being changed. We chose this hotel as we wanted somewhere with a pool to relax during the day as we had been to Singapore only a month before so we weren't bothered about being in the centre of everything. The hotel had this and a couple of running bikes that they call the gym so we thought great this will do. Now having read the reviews before i expected the staff to be lacking in the smiles etc and they werent very cheery at all. However whenever i needed something they did assist but all to often it seemed forced instead of willingly. The walls are very thin, and i echo what another review says that you may actually think someone is in your room its that thin. However most nights its quiet as it seems people sleep early and we were away from the lifts right at the end of the corridor on the 3rd floor. The room itself is small but we found it fine as it had everything you need and enough room to put your bags on the window ledge and around the room. Big window in room was nice too. Aircon was fine and worked well, if a little loud but ear plugs in and you're fine. Bathroom is small but fine for what it is, clean and water was hot and good pressure. Tv was LCD screen with good selection of channels, ESPN, HBO among others. Location is a 10min walk to Novena MRT which is loacted in a shopping mall with good selection of eateries. (Orchard road is 2 stops from Novena.) If you walk down to the MRT you can go to Union square shopping Mall which is 2min walk underground or situated across the road but harder this way due to traffic. This has a few more options to eat at if you need them. Never used the bus they were always coming and seemed easy enough to catch. Internet cafe across the road, $1 an hour with plenty of shops and 7elevens and atms round. Overall i liked how clean, modern, safe and convenient the location is. Yes the staff could be better trained and walls thicker but for the money this is a safe choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel But One Staff Spoils It All”
Reviews.Author: evaevrina
Reviews.Content: I and my partner went for a short staycation at this hotel on 4th-5th March 2010. Actually, being in my line, I want to experience myself this hotel as it was most quoted as one of the good budget hotel and would like to put this hotel under recommendation for my business clients. When we arrived, the door man smiled to us..The lobby was simple, clean and chic for a budget hotel...The malay girl that check us in seemed new but made the check in fast..Upon-check in, there was another guest whom was asking for the $69.00 promotion that was hanged largely outside the hotel, only to find out that the promotion is over...u guys need to put down the banner if the promotion is gone dear... We had our room on the 6th level.The room was nicely designed, I had no problem with anything but well, the toilet is really small...hmm..if you live in Singapore, it would be the size of your HDB storeroom. We tried the pool later, it was ok, although we have to bring our own room towels as there is no towels provided by the pool. After the swim, while resting in the room, i realized there's a leak on the ceiling, but since it was nothing serious, we just ignore.Our sleep was ok as there's not much noise around except if the person next door is entering the room. Everything was fine up till checking out. My partner went to the reception to hand over the room card. Only one person was on duty, a young chinese guy, wearing specs, if i'm not wrong red white frame (you should know who you are). Upon giving the card, he was at the computer, My partner say nicely that we are checking out, this guy just take the card, without looking at us and just keep quiet.We do nok know what to do, so we just walk offf...come'on, even if we are locals or you are very busy, your guest is to check out, would it pain to just turn your head to smile or say how's ur stay....Giving such an attitude really turns me off from this hotel, don't even ask me to recommend to my business clients...they will just have a bad impression on the hotels in Singapore...C'mon, there's a lot of bad reviews about the customer service at this hotel, the best that the management could do is to improve on this...

Reviews.Title: “budget rates, at the price of decent hospitality?”
Reviews.Author: LondonMadHatter
Reviews.Content: This is one of TripAdvisor's highest rated hotel in Singapore (top 30) with the lowest budget, (less than SGD100) so I was convinced enough to give it a try. Let's talk about the good bits 1. Clean hotel (bed sheets and towels and toilets are hygienically taken cared of) Now for the not-so-good part I can live with... 1. Small room- fits a queen-size bed and some spaces just enough for one person to move along its perimeter. 2. Toilet the size of a closet - Once you shower everything gets wet. No cloth to wipe your feet so the tiny room gets wet as well. 3. Location - It's a good 20-30min walk to nearest MRT (Novena station), so if you know the bus route by heart and willing to fork out extra for taxis then no problemo. There isnt much in the surrounding area to keep you interested (IMHO). Now for the part i seriously have issues with- 1. THE HOTEL STAFFs IS JUST PLAIN RUDE! Now I have been traveling around the world for quite abit, stayed in alot of different hotels, met alot of people from different tradition/background along the way, and I'm not the fussy type who would complain bout cold food or split drink or even bad arrangements/mistakes- but this hotel is ran by a group of people who shows it up in your face that they are not happy and they don't give a damn what you think! From my experience- upon arrival the person behind the counter just ignore you doing his own things despite minutes of waiting until you interrupt him for his attention and he goes "yes?", no smiles, no apology, no welcoming words, no (any relatively similar form of) thank you as you leave the counter or check-out (even if you say thank you to them they just keep quiet)! it's as if they just had their pay cut announced in the morning and you happened to come in at the wrong time. What's best later is when we called front desk for an iron, the reception just said "we're very busy at the moment and I'll get back to you when we're less busy", upon asking when can we expect the delivery he then went "just like I said, we're very busy and we'll get back to you later" (I don't think I've ever heard the phrase "just like i said" from a hotel inquiry). This is not just for one particular person, but a few staff which I've interacted with. 2. THE SOUND PROOF IS NON EXISTENCE- to simply describe it, when the neighboring tenant closes their door/switches/shower, you'll honestly believe someone is in your room doing so (I had woken up a few times at night thinking someone have entered my room). not to imagine the occasional shout/scream/chatter other tenants made in their room and walking past the corridor. Bottom line is, we all know Singapore lacks affordable hotels to start with, but I for one does not agree cheaper rates comes in a price of bad treatment by worst-seen behaved hotel staffs (I won't say lack of training as smiling is a simple gesture of welcoming, free of charge!). I've seen alot of polite/friendly/helpful Singaporean right upon entry at the custom but this hotel certainly does not portray good Singaporean hospitality. If you can afford a few extra 10s I recommend trying your luck elsewhere, you wont miss much here. Otherwise, just note down the name of those rude staffs and hopefully the manager will be more polite to assist you (if not, i'm sure the Singapore tourism board may do :)

Reviews.Title: “Best Budget Option in Thomson Area”
Reviews.Author: KiwiFromDownUnder
Reviews.Content: Don't expect 5 star service from the Value Hotel Thomson, but this hotel is definitely one of the cleanest and cheapest hotesl I've stayed in Singapore. Highly recommended for those on a budget. The pool is excellent but rarely used here, and forget about the gym - it's absolutely minimal. Top tips for the Thomson: - Request a room away from the elevator lifts. People are constantly coming and going from this place, and my first night was awful being nearby. Have since moved room. - MRT is ten minutes walk (West). This is part of the Novena shopping complex, so you've got Starbucks, food halls, bookshop (level 2), all just a walk away. Buses are good, but not in rush hour when the motorways are jammed. - Pillows are rock hard: bring your own! Seriously. - Pack a pair of jandals (for the toilet). The toilet / shower is combined into about a one metre square box... and so you're basically standing on the toilet when showering. Yuk. Cheers and happy travelling. Kiwi

Reviews.Title: “topped my list of best budget hotels currently”
Reviews.Author: LLJay1612
Reviews.Content: room was clean and classy though small... I always though u'll get wat u pay for, but was pleasantly surprised. Room was very clean and classy, though small, lots of sunshine coz there's a big glass window. We requested for room with dvd player as well. Service is average, with our request for additional pillows subtly rejected, reason being hotel is running full house. there's a food centre located two bus stops away. Breakfast is charged at 7 dollars a day per person but we were not asked upon check-in, internet access cost $10 a day... you can go across the street for internet usage for a dollar an hrs if I'm not wrong gym and pool are located in 7th storey... lastly thin walls, not for light sleepers. Overall I am very pleased with the hotel room n will certainly go there again.

Reviews.Title: “very clean but room is small with thin walls”
Reviews.Author: PRhospitality
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a superior room with queen size bed with a cost of SGD93 each night without tax. I had a very pleasant stay but there were some very small problems to make it perfect. Service There are three Value Hotels in Singapore. We went to the Value Hotel Balesteir and the front office assistant was very friendly. He told us the hotel we reserved was Value Hotel Thomson and gave us a hotel map, showed us the way and suggested us to take a taxi with a smile on his face which is very professional. The smell of Value Thomson was very pleasant in the lobby. But to be perfect, there was a small issue. Upon Check-in the front office assistant who was a girl wasn't really friendly, or lets say professional. No smile nor explanations when key card was given. I was expecting a 'Thank you for your reservation, we hope you a pleasant stay in Value Hotel Thomson' instead of a pair of big eyes staring at me expecting guests to ask her where the elevator and room is . But it wasn't a big deal. I didn't use any other services but in general staffs were friendly. Room The room was very small. The bed took the most place but it was very clean. Room facilities are very good with LCD screen having channels like HBO, TV2 and so many others. Hair dryer in the draw was even better than my own. tea making facilities, mugs, and internet cable in the drawer of the dressing table which is not free. There were no fridge. The toilet was very small. Toilet Tissue, Showering gel, showering cap, shampoo, toothbrush and toothpaste was provided. The central AC works quite well. The most important thing is you want to be careful because the bed moves easily that you might drop and forget some of your things under the bed. Housekeeping Bed was very comfortable. Sheets were very clean and well folded with standards during my stay. New coffee and milk tea was provided everyday during my stay. But it seems like housekeeping steward forgot to clean/flush the toilet the last day of our stay. The security is very good in the hotel during my stay. In general, it is a hotel that i would suggest to single travelers or young couples with budget who have been together for a longtime because of the thin walls( you can hear what exactly is going on in the toilet and noises outside the room).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nikal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and we were very happy with the room, service and location. There are a few minor points – the room is very small with the bed taking up most of the floor space. Therefore storage is limited to a few hangers in a very small wardrobe but there is a handy window ledge to store cases. As others have also noted the whole bathroom gets soaked when using the shower so expect constant wet feet. However, the room is very clean with a large LCD TV showing plenty of channels. The pool area is really nice with plenty of sun loungers. The location was fine once we got the hang of using the buses – on our first day we went on the open top bus tour (catch it near the tourist centre on Orchard Rd) which was great as it helped us to get our bearings. We were then confident to use the local buses as we knew landmarks / where we wanted to be. We preferred using the bus to taking the metro from Novena (about a 10 minute walk away) as you got to see things on your journey and it stops just outside the hotel on Balestier Rd. However if you walk round to the bus stops on Thomson Rd (two minute walk – near the traffic lights) there is a lot more choice of bus services which serve most destinations. We tried breakfast the first morning and it was ok but we prefer a (boring!) western breakfast of toast / croissants etc which were not provided. So the second morning we caught the bus to Novena (lazy – but once you get the hang of using the buses a $ to save the walk is appealing) where there was a great bakery serving lovely croissants and coffee. Taxi to/from the airport was less than $20. Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a low cost option – the positives far outweigh the negatives – and I would happily stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Most Decent 3 STAR Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vinatraveler
Reviews.Content: We couple stayed only here for 1 night for 89SGD. We arrived very early at 9am. The rate of taxi is 24 SGD. But, they said you can have it by 15SGD. Maybe our driver, tour us around. The receptionist approved our early check in of 10am since our room is available (what a good staff). The room is very nice. The bed is comfortable, with LCD TV. The comfort room has no divider so expect that when someone is using it , maybe just wait for your turn. But, overall the hotel is very nice. There is a cheap canteen outside the hotel. We went to Orchard thru Bus No. 143 nearby (10 mins. walk). All in all, this hotel is a good value compared to 3 star hotel which is located in GEYLANG.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL FOR SOLO TRAVELER”
Reviews.Author: shoegalf
Reviews.Content: For a single traveler like myself with aim for a shopping spree in Singapore this place is ideal because it fits my criteria: good location, clean and safe, budget price. The location is abt 1.5 km from Orchard, only a few bus stops away. You can take bus 143, 167 to Orchard from opposite Thomson Medical center - a few meters from the hotel. Novena MRT station is also close by - abt 15 min walk. But i highly recommend taking the bus because it takes you right in front of the Orchard shops. Then from there you can get to anywhere you want. Taxi to the airport is abt SGD 15 and to Orchard is abt SGD 8. 24 hours mini market are available near the hotel, also alot of eateries around. The room is very small but new and clean. No frills when you check in and check outs, no deposits required. You just pay the room in full and your good to go. The only thing i don't like is: the walls are quite thin and you can hear the noises from the hallway from people walking in and out, doors closing etc. But i dont mind so much. This place is still far better then other budget hotels in spore like 81 chains and supreme or beencolen which are old and more expensive. This place is perfect for single traveler or 2 girlfriends on a shopping spree gettaway. Unsuitable for couples and family with small children (due to the small rooms)

Reviews.Title: “VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: Maniinder
Reviews.Content: The hotels are small but with a very very big window in room covers for it... The staff is courteous and the service is good. The hotel is in the city and five minutes to orchard road by bus or car. Shall advice only for backpackers and/or budget couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great for short stays, very clean but small.”
Reviews.Author: evimun
